Job Description:
JDSAT is an Operations Research and Data Sciences firm currently seeking an enthusiastic, self-driven, and experienced Operations Research Analyst to the US Navy’s Bureau of Medicine and Surgery (BUMED) in strategic decision support through operations analysis to ensure medical forces ready for global contingency operations. These activities require careful and meticulous planning and analysis to balance programming limitations, operational demands, and unit readiness.
The qualified candidate will be educated and experienced in Operations Research or Mathematics. The qualified candidate blends professional and communication skills with technical analytical tasks using both qualitative and quantitative data. The ideal candidate will possess an advanced degree at least (4) years’ experience in a relevant field, including experience analyzing strategic operational challenges within the Department of Defense. The ideal candidate will possess advanced technical skills in statistical and data analysis and demonstrated ability to use common statistical programming languages (e.g. R, Python, or similar) to support a variety of analytical tasks. The candidate is expected to collect technical requirements, liaise with data owners, manipulate and analyze complex datasets, and provide analysis of results that can be visualized and easily comprehended by non-technical customers. The candidate will produce technical data analysis on several existing workstreams; work with customers to evaluate new requirements; serve as a technical expert capable of clearly explaining technical methodologies in lay terms; deliver technical solutions that meet requirements; and evaluate datasets to creatively explore how they can be developed into new workstreams.

The Challenge:
Are you ready to take an active role in cyber defense for the pharmaceutical industry? Are you looking for an opportunity to protect critical infrastructure from the constant onslaught of cyber attacks? If you want to sharpen your skills by analyzing threats real-time, then come join our team.
As an analyst on our SOC team, you’ll monitor and analyze threats using state-of-the-art tools like Cortex XSOAR, Crowd Strike, Carbon Black, Splunk, Securonix, and Service Now.
You’ll work with the team to understand, mitigate, and respond to threats quickly, restoring operations and limiting the impact. You’ll analyze incidents to figure out just how many systems are affected and assist with recovery efforts. You’ll combine threat intelligence, event data, and assessments from recent events and identify patterns to understand attackers’ goals to stop them from succeeding. This is a great opportunity to build your cybersecurity expertise with hands on experience in threat assessment and incident response. Join us as we protect our nation’s capability to produce life-saving pharmaceuticals from threat actors.

We are seeking a Marketing Operations Analyst on a contract basis to help support our Customer’s business needs. This role is strategically important in driving definition around our internal marketing processes. The Marketing Ops Analyst will lead the process mapping, documentation, and support of the campaigns planning and execution process by working with stakeholders across Legal, Privacy, and Procurement to define requirements, SOPs, SLAs, LAMA’s, contacts, and key decision points for channel execution across the Novi marketing team.

What You’ll Do:
Work with stakeholders to define, organize, document marketing campaign requirements in support of PXFN, Privacy, and Legal reviews in order to drive efficiencies in campaigns execution.

Build out and manage flow diagrams modeling how work is done, accountable parties, prioritization of reviews, when reviews and approvals are required by legal, privacy, and cross-functional stakeholders for all channels.

Provide ongoing support for teams to ensure campaigns can execute efficiently by defining SLAs, removing blockers across privacy, legal, procurement, RACI, and other review types.

Identify gap areas within our current internal processes, research, and/or work with cross-functional teams to determine the best course of action to correct, and present recommendations on the process, technical, or data improvements that address business needs or resolve gaps.

Own the weekly publication of the marketing campaigns calendar by working closely with stakeholders across Brand, Growth, Web, Social, and Product Marketing to ensure projects are properly tagged for prioritization review within Workfront.

Design and create training materials (e.g. job aids, reference guides, training manuals) and run training sessions as needed.

Outlining/documenting RACI and workflow processes to increase scalability and internal efficiency of marketing organizations.

Implementing processes that ensure all of marketing is adhering to global privacy, legal, and governance laws.

Overseeing and managing marketing operations processes, campaigns budgets/analytics, tracking and reporting across all marketing channels for enterprise marketing.


7+ years’ hands-on progressive experience as a Marketing or Business Analyst, Marketing Process Analyst, or equivalent role translating business requirements to design workable marketing processes and solutions.

Expertise with global channels privacy laws, and setting up marketing processes and guardrails to abide by those laws.

Experience eliciting high-level business requirements and creating detailed documentation like requirement traceability matrices, workflow diagrams, and use-cases.

Self-starters can work independently and proactively to resolve issues, take ownership of tools and processes.

Intellectual curiosity, flexibility, and strict attention to detail.

Financial Services industry knowledge is a plus.

Experience with implementing a documentation system.

Job Title: Market Research Analyst
Department: Trade Development
Terminal: Garden City Terminal, Savannah, GA
FLSA Status: Salaried / Exempt

JOB OVERVIEW: Under the direction of the Manager of Marketing, the Market Research Analyst designs and implements market research and statistical analysis to help identify new business opportunities. Upholds the values of the GPA to promote Safety, Integrity, Respect, Community, Creativity and Opportunity. Promotes a safe work environment by participating in safety initiatives and reporting unsafe conditions and behaviors.

JOB DUTIES AND REQUIREMENTS: 1. Develops, writes, and maintains monthly, quarterly and yearly analysis of market trends and market shares to uncover weaknesses and strengths for GPA marketing.

2. Identifies and analyzes key market segment developments that may affect GPA performance.

3. Advises on threats and opportunities that emerge out of market analysis.

4. Based on analysis of data, recommends forward-thinking ideas and strategies to exploit new markets and develop new sales leads.

5. Profiles services, carriers, and ports.

6. Prepares and updates a customized presentation that includes market statistics, photos, graphs, and inland cost comparisons for various meetings.

7. Prepares, maintains, and reports on actual versus previously projected performance of GPA, other ports, carriers, shippers, etc. Uses hindsight to determine if past market analysis was sound.

8. Maintains data system that enables GPA employees to easily retrieve marketing data in both general and customized queries. Trains and assists GPA employees on the data system as needed. Ensures that the system and data functions properly, coordinating with IT and vendors as necessary.

9. When necessary (such as in highly customized queries), provides data requested by GPA staff.

10. Coordinates with IT in the development of standardized reports to be available through the internal network (EIS) to authorized users. This will include market share by ports, services/carriers, and commodities for containerized, breakbulk, bulk, and vehicles.

11. Designs, develops and maintains specialized databases for the marketing department from identified data sources, ensuring accuracy and completeness.

12. Maintains open and productive communication with all Trade Development staff and other divisions within GPA to identify and meet their needs for market information.

13. In conjunction with the Marketing Team, maintains the master industry conferences and events list for Trade Development consideration. Coordinates all aspects of conference and event sponsorship and booth logistics, collateral material design and production, and ensures that representation to the event has all necessary information.

14. Must be willing to work a flexible schedule as needed.

10. Performs other duties as assigned.


Ability to assemble, analyze, and discern key trends from complex data and convert this information into appropriate written and oral recommendations. Ability to initiate extensive studies related to world trade, transportation logistics, and regional impact. Strong computer skills in Microsoft Excel, Access and PowerPoint required. Knowledge of Quark, Photoshop, and other software desired. Works well under pressure and meets deadlines. Excellent written, oral, and presentation skills required. Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to interact effectively and professionally with GPA staff on all levels of administration as well as internal and external customers in order to create a results driven, team oriented environment.


Four year college degree in marketing, economics or related field desired. Experience in market research and statistical analysis desired, preferably within the marine terminal operations community. Strong command of data sources, experience gathering and manipulating data sources and the capacity to generate and obtain new sources for marketing information.


Must meet the criteria for and obtain a Transportation Worker Identification Credential (TWIC). Valid state driver's license required.

Company: Rigid Tactical
Asymmetric Threat Operations Research Analyst (ORSA)
Location: Fort Belvoir, VA and Reston, VA
Minimum Clearance: TS/SCI
Description:
As a Rigid Tactical Operations Research Analyst (ORSA), you will provide support to our government client and forward deployed units in countering improvised threats and the networks that finance, build or employ such threats. Duties will include taking structured and unstructured data and distilling the information into a cohesive analytical product for the senior military audience. You will execute your mission through integration of data from diverse intelligence disciplines, including SIGINT, MASINT, GEOINT, IMINT, and HUMINT to illuminate entities and networks of interest, supporting both conventional and other forces CONUS and OCONUS.

Your expertise will support multi intelligence teams, social analytical teams, and special operations analytical teams and include actionable insight reporting based on data driven analysis of operations. You will provide the subject matter expertise that is highly skilled at data mining, statistical analysis, causal analysis, and geospatial analysis. You will analyze unit operations through Operations Research techniques, produce trends assessments and analysis, C-IED analytical products and provide information to the government client regarding the effectiveness of the client initiatives.
Your work will result in relevant and timely analytical support to a range of deployed units including Regional Command, Division Support elements, US Brigade Combat Teams, regimental Combat Teams, Counter-Improvised Explosive Device (C-IED) Support Teams, Special Operations organizations, Coalition Units, Security Force Assistance and Advisory Teams (SFAATs), Provisional reconstruction Battalions, and Global Response Forces.
You will support C-IED/Counter-Improvised Threat efforts in a current theater of operations, developing pattern analysis methods formulation of recommendations to operational commanders. You will additionally facilitate data transfer from theater to CONUS, support units in mission training events, readiness exercises, and pre-deployment rehearsals.

Company: Rigid Tactical
Asymmetric Threat Operations Research Analyst (ORSA)
Location: Fort Belvoir, VA and Reston, VA
Minimum Clearance: TS/SCI
Description:
As a Rigid Tactical Operations Research Analyst (ORSA), you will provide support to our government client and forward deployed units in countering improvised threats and the networks that finance, build or employ such threats. Duties will include taking structured and unstructured data and distilling the information into a cohesive analytical product for the senior military audience. You will execute your mission through integration of data from diverse intelligence disciplines, including SIGINT, MASINT, GEOINT, IMINT, and HUMINT to illuminate entities and networks of interest, supporting both conventional and other forces CONUS and OCONUS.

Your expertise will support multi intelligence teams, social analytical teams, and special operations analytical teams and include actionable insight reporting based on data driven analysis of operations. You will provide the subject matter expertise that is highly skilled at data mining, statistical analysis, causal analysis, and geospatial analysis. You will analyze unit operations through Operations Research techniques, produce trends assessments and analysis, C-IED analytical products and provide information to the government client regarding the effectiveness of the client initiatives.
Your work will result in relevant and timely analytical support to a range of deployed units including Regional Command, Division Support elements, US Brigade Combat Teams, regimental Combat Teams, Counter-Improvised Explosive Device (C-IED) Support Teams, Special Operations organizations, Coalition Units, Security Force Assistance and Advisory Teams (SFAATs), Provisional reconstruction Battalions, and Global Response Forces.
You will support C-IED/Counter-Improvised Threat efforts in a current theater of operations, developing pattern analysis methods formulation of recommendations to operational commanders. You will additionally facilitate data transfer from theater to CONUS, support units in mission training events, readiness exercises, and pre-deployment rehearsals.

Operations Research Analyst-- Utilizes data science techniques, methods, and tools to evaluate, manipulate, analyze, and graphically represent Cyber Mission Force (CMF) readiness and manpower data. Researches, collects, and analyzes readiness data related to manpower, training, equipment, and retention from various sources to develop better understanding of cyberspace operations readiness assessments and support specifically related to CMF team composition, training and qualification standards, and manpower status. Contributes to uncovering and resolving issues associated with the development and implementation of operational programs. Interprets policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and objectives and applies operations research principles and techniques to compound analytic needs. Applies data-mining techniques, statistical analysis, and builds high-quality prediction systems. Identifies issues and priorities affecting readiness of cyber teams, individual cyber work roles, and retention of the cyber work force.

BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. The Office of Research and Policy Innovation is the DSS policy analysis, research, and program evaluation unit, informing high-level decision-making across DSS-HRA-DHS. Through rigorous research studies and evaluations, ORPI develops and analyzes the evidence base for HRA and DHS work and provides unbiased recommendations regarding priority issues and initiatives to the NYC Department of Social Services (DSS) Commissioner, the Human Resources Administration (HRA) and Department of Homeless Services (DHS) Administrators, the DSS Chief Program Planning and Financial Management Officer, and HRA and DHS program leadership. ORPI is additionally responsible for providing strategic direction in the development and monitoring of collaborative research and evaluation efforts and grant proposals.

ORPI is recruiting for one (1) City Research Scientist II who will:

Conduct program evaluations of pilot programs and other priority interventions across a wide range of DSS/HRA/DHS program areas—and using a wide range of methods. Evaluation designs include experimental and quasi-experimental impact evaluations, mixed-methods implementation and outcome studies, and cost-benefit analyses.

JDSAT is an Operations Research and Data Sciences firm currently seeking an enthusiastic, self-driven, and experienced Operations Research Analyst to the US Navy’s Bureau of Medicine and Surgery (BUMED) in strategic decision support through operations analysis to ensure medical forces ready for global contingency operations. These activities require careful and meticulous planning and analysis to balance programming limitations, operational demands, and unit readiness.
The qualified candidate will be educated and experienced in Operations Research or Mathematics. The qualified candidate blends professional and communication skills with technical analytical tasks using both qualitative and quantitative data. The ideal candidate will possess an advanced degree at least (4) years’ experience in a relevant field, including experience analyzing strategic operational challenges within the Department of Defense. The ideal candidate will possess advanced technical skills in statistical and data analysis and demonstrated ability to use common statistical programming languages (e.g. R, Python, or similar) to support a variety of analytical tasks. The candidate is expected to collect technical requirements, liaise with data owners, manipulate and analyze complex datasets, and provide analysis of results that can be visualized and easily comprehended by non-technical customers. The candidate will produce technical data analysis on several existing workstreams; work with customers to evaluate new requirements; serve as a technical expert capable of clearly explaining technical methodologies in lay terms; deliver technical solutions that meet requirements; and evaluate datasets to creatively explore how they can be developed into new workstreams.

JDSAT is an Operations Research and Data Sciences firm currently seeking an enthusiastic, self-driven, and experienced Operations Research Analyst to the US Navy’s Bureau of Medicine and Surgery (BUMED) in strategic decision support through operations analysis to ensure medical forces ready for global contingency operations. Job Description:
Data Systems Analysts, Inc. is searching for a Data Analyst to help modernize and transform data collection and analysis efforts for an Army customer. This position is located in Charlottesville, VA.

Required Education, Certifications and Security Clearance

BS degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Math or related discipline with a minimum of 1-year of experience with data analysis
o Substitution is AA in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Math or related discipline w/3 years related experience
TS // SCI (May require CI polygraph)
Must have a Security+ (or other IAT Level II cert) or be able to obtain one within 90 days of hire.

Required Qualifications
Documented proficiency with R or Python, and SQL to manipulate data and draw insights from large and small data sets.
Documented experience implementing a variety of supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and knowledge of their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Documented experience implementing statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and applications
Documented experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders.
Documented experience with MS Office tools including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
Documented experience with AWS, in particular products related to: analytics, compute, database, developer tools, and machine learning.
Skilled with data retrieval and storage, visualization and warehousing, and extract-transform-load (ETL) processes.
Knowledge of database solutions including SQL, NoSQL (e.g. MongoDB) and graph (e.g. Neo4j)
Knowledge of data visualization tools, such as D3.js, ggplot, Bokeh, etc.
Ability to translate an intelligence problem into a Data Science problem, and to work with the Intelligence Analysts and ACE Chief to refine understanding of the problem.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; good interpersonal skills and communication with all levels of leadership.
Driven to learn and master new technologies and techniques; desire to maintain currency on latest industry trends including completing additional training; able to articulate trends and potential clearly and confidently.
Creative problem solver who thrives when presented with a challenge; able to analyze problems and strategize for better solutions; strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on production for re-use.
Goal-oriented, encouraging to team and staff; comfortable as a team- player, leader and mentor


Desired Qualifications
Five years intelligence analysis experience is desired (MOS 35/350 series or other DoD/IC equivalent).
Experience with ICITE Cloud concepts and architectures
Knowledge of Agile software development project methodologies
Understanding of enterprise-level data analysis, machine-learning, operations research, modeling, and business/mission intelligence tools. Developing, implementing, integrating, and evaluating IC data architecture-related projects

JDSAT is an Operations Research and Data Sciences firm currently seeking an enthusiastic, self-driven, and experienced Operations Research Analyst to the US Navy’s Bureau of Medicine and Surgery (BUMED) in strategic decision support through operations analysis to ensure medical forces ready for global contingency operations. These activities require careful and meticulous planning and analysis to balance programming limitations, operational demands, and unit readiness.
The qualified candidate will be educated and experienced in Operations Research or Mathematics. The qualified candidate blends professional and communication skills with technical analytical tasks using both qualitative and quantitative data. The ideal candidate will possess an advanced degree at least (4) years’ experience in a relevant field, including experience analyzing strategic operational challenges within the Department of Defense. The ideal candidate will possess advanced technical skills in statistical and data analysis and demonstrated ability to use common statistical programming languages (e.g. R, Python, or similar) to support a variety of analytical tasks. The candidate is expected to collect technical requirements, liaise with data owners, manipulate and analyze complex datasets, and provide analysis of results that can be visualized and easily comprehended by non-technical customers. The candidate will produce technical data analysis on several existing workstreams; work with customers to evaluate new requirements; serve as a technical expert capable of clearly explaining technical methodologies in lay terms; deliver technical solutions that meet requirements; and evaluate datasets to creatively explore how they can be developed into new workstreams.

Operations Research Analyst-- Utilizes data science techniques, methods, and tools to evaluate, manipulate, analyze, and graphically represent Cyber Mission Force (CMF) readiness and manpower data. Researches, collects, and analyzes readiness data related to manpower, training, equipment, and retention from various sources to develop better understanding of cyberspace operations readiness assessments and support specifically related to CMF team composition, training and qualification standards, and manpower status. Contributes to uncovering and resolving issues associated with the development and implementation of operational programs. Interprets policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and objectives and applies operations research principles and techniques to compound analytic needs. Applies data-mining techniques, statistical analysis, and builds high-quality prediction systems. Identifies issues and priorities affecting readiness of cyber teams, individual cyber work roles, and retention of the cyber work force.

Job Description:
The Office of Research and Policy Innovation is the DSS policy analysis, research, and program evaluation unit, informing high-level decision-making across DSS-HRA-DHS. Through rigorous research studies and evaluations, ORPI develops and analyzes the evidence base for HRA and DHS work and provides unbiased recommendations regarding priority issues and initiatives to the NYC Department of Social Services (DSS) Commissioner, the Human Resources Administration (HRA) and Department of Homeless Services (DHS) Administrators, the DSS Chief Program Planning and Financial Management Officer, and HRA and DHS program leadership. ORPI is additionally responsible for providing strategic direction in the development and monitoring of collaborative research and evaluation efforts and grant proposals.

ORPI is recruiting for one (1) City Research Scientist II who will:

Conduct program evaluations of pilot programs and other priority interventions across a wide range of DSS/HRA/DHS program areas—and using a wide range of methods. Evaluation designs include experimental and quasi-experimental impact evaluations, mixed-methods implementation and outcome studies, and cost-benefit analyses.

High-performing candidates who are adaptive, ready to engage in problem-solving, dare to think differently, have the technical skills to deliver, and want to make a difference in their community are encouraged to apply. This is a supervisory role and reports to the PRCR Operations Manager.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Develop, monitor, and oversee the department's annual operating budget (approximately $18 million) including revenue and expenditures;Collect, analyze and interpret financial data;Identify and analyze trends, forecast revenues and expenditures, and highlight areas that require attention and action;Oversee the department’s financial functions, including A/R, AP, and Purchasing;Serve as departmental contact for budget training, development, and troubleshootingCoordinate appropriation transfers and grants for the department;Provide in-depth research and fiscal analysis on special projects for the department;Compile and report financial data for national and local surveys;Respond to budgetary and financial inquiries from Town Council, internal and external auditor, other departments, and citizens;Participate in teams providing cost-benefit analysis and program evaluation to develop viable recommendations;Provide project manager leadership;Act as liaison with the Town’s Finance Department and a representative on departmental and Town-wide committees.BudgetClarifies procedures relative to budgetary matters, revenue estimates, contractual matters, and various pricing models;Develops and implements budget calendar; prepares departmental summaries and coordinates the preparation of all divisions' narratives and performance standards;Reviews department budget inputs prior to submission to budget office for operations and maintenance and Priority Based Budgeting;Provides management/analytical review of all divisions' operating budgets to ensure consistency and appropriateness of the requests; recommends alternative funding methods;Facilitates with division managers for the input and formulation of CIB/P;ContractsInitiates, develops, and writes contractual documents for the department including service agreements, licensing agreements, lease agreements, joint use agreements, memorandums of understanding and design and project agreements; Oversees the development of RFP's for the department;Establishes procedures relative to contract management and ensures conformity of services by the provider, licensees, lessees, entertainers, performers, event promoters, and design and project companies;Oversees contract management and contract administration for the department. Authorizes and approves contracts of the department with reviews for compliance with Town ordinances, policies, statutes, and risk management;Reviews, authorize, and approves requisitions for payments for departmental requirements such as the purchase of goods and services, consulting, design, and constructions projects;Risk ManagementServes as departmental risk management representative and safety coordinator; Reviews employee accidents information and patron accidents. Recommends changes to prevent re-occurrences or to enhance patron safety;Develops and implements procedures for operations and safety of programs, participants, equipment, facilities and assess risk; assesses risk and ensures compliance with established risk management procedures;Additional TasksAnalyzes procedures for facility rentals, recreation programs, instructors, merchandise sales, and inventories;Gathers, formulates, and reviews division inputs for the department to ensure conformity with town guidelines and policies, statutes, employment practices; makes recommendations to division managers and Department Director;Quantifies and makes recommendations on departmental procedures to include reviewing staffing levels, procedures, and financial requirements;Develops recommendations on operational improvements and conducts training on new or revised operations procedures and policies;Oversees grant-related projects and ensures proper procedures for tracking progress, approving payments, and reporting necessary information to the Town's finance department and appropriate grant authority;Handles special projects as assigned and needed; provides information about the department's programs as requested;Reviews and responds to citizen inquiries and complaints;Oversees and manages the Volunteer Background Investigation program for the department;Conducts independent financial internal audits of PRCR facilities to access compliances with cash handling procedures, inventory management, P-Card transactions, petty cash management, and other on-site cash funds as assigned to facilities, employee time input, and approval;Develops and administers policies for the department for document retention. Ensures Department compliance Town and NC Department of Cultural Resources.Performs other job-related tasks as required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Thorough knowledge of department objectives, procedures, and services; thorough knowledge of principles, practices, and techniques of public or business administration; thorough knowledge of operational analysis principles; thorough knowledge of personal computers and related software, especially spreadsheet applications; thorough knowledge of research and analysis methods and techniques; thorough knowledge of public liability and insurance; ability to analyze administrative problems, to make sound recommendations for their solution and to prepare working procedures; ability to communicate ideas effectively both orally and in writing; ability to plan, organize and direct the work of others; ability to organize and plan processes; ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with officials, other employees and the general public; ability to prepare complex records and reports; ability to work independently; ability to apply general knowledge and previous experience to the particular problem and setting of the assignment.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor's degree in business, public administration, or a closely related field and considerable experience at an administrative or policy review level in local government or private sector. The Protective Intelligence Center (PIC) has a simple but critical mission: protect our associates and support the protective mission. PIC Intelligence Analysts (IAs) leverage advanced technology, OSINT and HUMINT collections, and internal company subject matter experts to provide timely, accurate and actionable intelligence, thereby empowering protectors and analysts to better serve their protectees and clients.

JDSAT is an Operations Research and Data Sciences firm currently seeking an enthusiastic, self-driven, and experienced Operations Research Analyst to the US Navy’s Bureau of Medicine and Surgery (BUMED) in strategic decision support through operations analysis to ensure medical forces ready for global contingency operations. These activities require careful and meticulous planning and analysis to balance programming limitations, operational demands, and unit readiness.
The qualified candidate will be educated and experienced in Operations Research or Mathematics. The qualified candidate blends professional and communication skills with technical analytical tasks using both qualitative and quantitative data. The ideal candidate will possess an advanced degree at least (4) years’ experience in a relevant field, including experience analyzing strategic operational challenges within the Department of Defense. The ideal candidate will possess advanced technical skills in statistical and data analysis and demonstrated ability to use common statistical programming languages (e.g. R, Python, or similar) to support a variety of analytical tasks. The candidate is expected to collect technical requirements, liaise with data owners, manipulate and analyze complex datasets, and provide analysis of results that can be visualized and easily comprehended by non-technical customers. The candidate will produce technical data analysis on several existing workstreams; work with customers to evaluate new requirements; serve as a technical expert capable of clearly explaining technical methodologies in lay terms; deliver technical solutions that meet requirements; and evaluate datasets to creatively explore how they can be developed into new workstreams.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Develop, monitor, and oversee the department's annual operating budget (approximately $18 million) including revenue and expenditures;Collect, analyze and interpret financial data;Identify and analyze trends, forecast revenues and expenditures, and highlight areas that require attention and action;Oversee the department’s financial functions, including A/R, AP, and Purchasing;Serve as departmental contact for budget training, development, and troubleshootingCoordinate appropriation transfers and grants for the department;Provide in-depth research and fiscal analysis on special projects for the department;Compile and report financial data for national and local surveys;Respond to budgetary and financial inquiries from Town Council, internal and external auditor, other departments, and citizens;Participate in teams providing cost-benefit analysis and program evaluation to develop viable recommendations;Provide project manager leadership;Act as liaison with the Town’s Finance Department and a representative on departmental and Town-wide committees.BudgetClarifies procedures relative to budgetary matters, revenue estimates, contractual matters, and various pricing models;Develops and implements budget calendar; prepares departmental summaries and coordinates the preparation of all divisions' narratives and performance standards;Reviews department budget inputs prior to submission to budget office for operations and maintenance and Priority Based Budgeting;Provides management/analytical review of all divisions' operating budgets to ensure consistency and appropriateness of the requests; recommends alternative funding methods;Facilitates with division managers for the input and formulation of CIB/P;ContractsInitiates, develops, and writes contractual documents for the department including service agreements, licensing agreements, lease agreements, joint use agreements, memorandums of understanding and design and project agreements; Oversees the development of RFP's for the department;Establishes procedures relative to contract management and ensures conformity of services by the provider, licensees, lessees, entertainers, performers, event promoters, and design and project companies;Oversees contract management and contract administration for the department. Authorizes and approves contracts of the department with reviews for compliance with Town ordinances, policies, statutes, and risk management;Reviews, authorize, and approves requisitions for payments for departmental requirements such as the purchase of goods and services, consulting, design, and constructions projects;Risk ManagementServes as departmental risk management representative and safety coordinator; Reviews employee accidents information and patron accidents. Recommends changes to prevent re-occurrences or to enhance patron safety;Develops and implements procedures for operations and safety of programs, participants, equipment, facilities and assess risk; assesses risk and ensures compliance with established risk management procedures;Additional TasksAnalyzes procedures for facility rentals, recreation programs, instructors, merchandise sales, and inventories;Gathers, formulates, and reviews division inputs for the department to ensure conformity with town guidelines and policies, statutes, employment practices; makes recommendations to division managers and Department Director;Quantifies and makes recommendations on departmental procedures to include reviewing staffing levels, procedures, and financial requirements;Develops recommendations on operational improvements and conducts training on new or revised operations procedures and policies;Oversees grant-related projects and ensures proper procedures for tracking progress, approving payments, and reporting necessary information to the Town's finance department and appropriate grant authority;Handles special projects as assigned and needed; provides information about the department's programs as requested;Reviews and responds to citizen inquiries and complaints;Oversees and manages the Volunteer Background Investigation program for the department;Conducts independent financial internal audits of PRCR facilities to access compliances with cash handling procedures, inventory management, P-Card transactions, petty cash management, and other on-site cash funds as assigned to facilities, employee time input, and approval;Develops and administers policies for the department for document retention. Ensures Department compliance Town and NC Department of Cultural Resources.Performs other job-related tasks as required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Thorough knowledge of department objectives, procedures, and services; thorough knowledge of principles, practices, and techniques of public or business administration; thorough knowledge of operational analysis principles; thorough knowledge of personal computers and related software, especially spreadsheet applications; thorough knowledge of research and analysis methods and techniques; thorough knowledge of public liability and insurance; ability to analyze administrative problems, to make sound recommendations for their solution and to prepare working procedures; ability to communicate ideas effectively both orally and in writing; ability to plan, organize and direct the work of others; ability to organize and plan processes; ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with officials, other employees and the general public; ability to prepare complex records and reports; ability to work independently; ability to apply general knowledge and previous experience to the particular problem and setting of the assignment.

Founded in 1985, SelectQuote provides solutions that help consumers protect their most valuable assets: their families, health and property. The company pioneered the model of providing unbiased comparisons from multiple, highly rated insurance companies allowing consumers to choose the policy and terms that best meet their unique needs. Two foundational pillars underpin SelectQuote's success: a strong force of highly trained and skilled agents, who provide consultative needs analysis for every consumer, and proprietary technology that sources and routes high-quality leads. JDSAT is an Operations Research and Data Sciences firm currently seeking an enthusiastic, self-driven, and experienced Operations Research Analyst to the US Navy’s Bureau of Medicine and Surgery (BUMED) in strategic decision support through operations analysis to ensure medical forces ready for global contingency operations. These activities require careful and meticulous planning and analysis to balance programming limitations, operational demands, and unit readiness.
The qualified candidate will be educated and experienced in Operations Research or Mathematics. The qualified candidate blends professional and communication skills with technical analytical tasks using both qualitative and quantitative data. The ideal candidate will possess an advanced degree at least (4) years’ experience in a relevant field, including experience analyzing strategic operational challenges within the Department of Defense. The ideal candidate will possess advanced technical skills in statistical and data analysis and demonstrated ability to use common statistical programming languages (e.g. R, Python, or similar) to support a variety of analytical tasks. The candidate is expected to collect technical requirements, liaise with data owners, manipulate and analyze complex datasets, and provide analysis of results that can be visualized and easily comprehended by non-technical customers. The candidate will produce technical data analysis on several existing workstreams; work with customers to evaluate new requirements; serve as a technical expert capable of clearly explaining technical methodologies in lay terms; deliver technical solutions that meet requirements; and evaluate datasets to creatively explore how they can be developed into new workstreams.

JDSAT is an Operations Research and Data Sciences firm currently seeking an enthusiastic, self-driven, and experienced Operations Research Analyst to the US Navy’s Bureau of Medicine and Surgery (BUMED) in strategic decision support through operations analysis to ensure medical forces ready for global contingency operations. These activities require careful and meticulous planning and analysis to balance programming limitations, operational demands, and unit readiness.
The qualified candidate will be educated and experienced in Operations Research or Mathematics. The qualified candidate blends professional and communication skills with technical analytical tasks using both qualitative and quantitative data. The ideal candidate will possess an advanced degree at least (4) years’ experience in a relevant field, including experience analyzing strategic operational challenges within the Department of Defense. The ideal candidate will possess advanced technical skills in statistical and data analysis and demonstrated ability to use common statistical programming languages (e.g. R, Python, or similar) to support a variety of analytical tasks. The candidate is expected to collect technical requirements, liaise with data owners, manipulate and analyze complex datasets, and provide analysis of results that can be visualized and easily comprehended by non-technical customers. The candidate will produce technical data analysis on several existing workstreams; work with customers to evaluate new requirements; serve as a technical expert capable of clearly explaining technical methodologies in lay terms; deliver technical solutions that meet requirements; and evaluate datasets to creatively explore how they can be developed into new workstreams.

Researches, collects, and analyzes readiness data related to manpower, training, equipment, and retention from various sources to develop better understanding of cyberspace operations readiness assessments and support specifically related to CMF team composition, training and qualification standards, and manpower status. Contributes to uncovering and resolving issues associated with the development and implementation of operational programs. Interprets policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and objectives and applies operations research principles and techniques to compound analytic needs. Applies data-mining techniques, statistical analysis, and builds high-quality prediction systems. Identifies issues and priorities affecting readiness of cyber teams, individual cyber work roles, and retention of the cyber work force.

BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.

At BAE Systems, we celebrate the array of skills, experiences, and perspectives our employees bring to the table. For us, differences are a source of strength. We’re laser-focused on high performance, and we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where all employees can innovate and thrive. Here, you will not only build your career, but you will also enjoy work-life balance, uncover new experiences, and collaborate with passionate colleagues.

The Business Intelligence Analyst, is a member of the HRIS team providing for the Human Capital technology, analytics and reporting needs of Vanderbilt University Medical Center. The team utilizes various tools including Tableau, Oracle BI, SAP Business Objects as well as MS Access and advanced Excel to provide dashboards and recurring functional reporting on a weekly and monthly cadence. The Office of Research and Policy Innovation is the DSS policy analysis, research, and program evaluation unit, informing high-level decision-making across DSS-HRA-DHS. Through rigorous research studies and evaluations, ORPI develops and analyzes the evidence base for HRA and DHS work and provides unbiased recommendations regarding priority issues and initiatives to the NYC Department of Social Services (DSS) Commissioner, the Human Resources Administration (HRA) and Department of Homeless Services (DHS) Administrators, the DSS Chief Program Planning and Financial Management Officer, and HRA and DHS program leadership. ORPI is additionally responsible for providing strategic direction in the development and monitoring of collaborative research and evaluation efforts and grant proposals.

ORPI is recruiting for one (1) City Research Scientist II who will:

Conduct program evaluations of pilot programs and other priority interventions across a wide range of DSS/HRA/DHS program areas—and using a wide range of methods. Evaluation designs include experimental and quasi-experimental impact evaluations, mixed-methods implementation and outcome studies, and cost-benefit analyses.

The Office of Research and Policy Innovation is the DSS policy analysis, research, and program evaluation unit, informing high-level decision-making across DSS-HRA-DHS. Through rigorous research studies and evaluations, ORPI develops and analyzes the evidence base for HRA and DHS work and provides unbiased recommendations regarding priority issues and initiatives to the NYC Department of Social Services (DSS) Commissioner, the Human Resources Administration (HRA) and Department of Homeless Services (DHS) Administrators, the DSS Chief Program Planning and Financial Management Officer, and HRA and DHS program leadership. ORPI is additionally responsible for providing strategic direction in the development and monitoring of collaborative research and evaluation efforts and grant proposals.

ORPI is recruiting for one (1) City Research Scientist II who will:

Conduct program evaluations of pilot programs and other priority interventions across a wide range of DSS/HRA/DHS program areas—and using a wide range of methods. Evaluation designs include experimental and quasi-experimental impact evaluations, mixed-methods implementation and outcome studies, and cost-benefit analyses.

CACI is looking for an Open Source Intelligence Analyst to conduct open source production based on sources and information available from public, private, and U.S. and foreign government open source materials, within established security protocols. This position involves the analysis of foreign and domestic-based publicly available information to identify trends, patterns, and relationships that provide unique insights to address defense intelligence requirements. Characterize the adversary. Research the structure, ideology, intentions, tactics, and capabilities of adversarial organizations to develop threat characterization using a combination of both classified and unclassified sources.

Battea is currently in a hybrid work model, balancing in-office and work-from-home.
We are looking to fill multiple data analyst roles ranging from junior to senior level.
Background:
Founded in the mid‐1990’s, Battea – Class Action Services, is the preeminent provider of securities class action recovery services to the institutional investment community. Battea processes detailed historical trade data and efficiently handles filings and collections of class action settlement recoveries on behalf of hedge funds and proprietary trading firms. Through its highly automated Claims Engine technology, Battea provides institutional investors with a full-service, outsourced solution for securities class action claims processing.
We are looking for talented individuals that possess a unique combination of business acumen, technical skills, securities industry knowledge as well as strong interpersonal skills in order to provide technical data analysis and innovative problem solving skills. The role entails in depth data analysis and collaborating with data team co-workers and Customer Service Representatives to drive automation and efficient and timely data processing.

Founded in 1985, SelectQuote provides solutions that help consumers protect their most valuable assets: their families, health and property. The company pioneered the model of providing unbiased comparisons from multiple, highly rated insurance companies allowing consumers to choose the policy and terms that best meet their unique needs. Two foundational pillars underpin SelectQuote's success: a strong force of highly trained and skilled agents, who provide consultative needs analysis for every consumer, and proprietary technology that sources and routes high-quality leads. The company has three core business lines: SelectQuote Senior, SelectQuote Life and SelectQuote Auto and Home. SelectQuote Senior, the largest and fastest-growing business, serves the needs of a demographic that sees 10,000 people turn 65 each day with a range of Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement plans.

The Protective Intelligence Center (PIC) has a simple but critical mission: protect our associates and support the protective mission. PIC Intelligence Analysts (IAs) leverage advanced technology, OSINT and HUMINT collections, and internal company subject matter experts to provide timely, accurate and actionable intelligence, thereby empowering protectors and analysts to better serve their protectees and clients.
As a PIC IA, you will identify, track, analyze, assess, and report on known and emerging risks to the safety and security of our associates and clients. You will monitor a wide variety of risk vectors including geopolitical events, natural hazards, crime, terrorism, health concerns etc.

JDSAT is an Operations Research and Data Sciences firm currently seeking an enthusiastic, self-driven, and experienced Operations Research Analyst to the US Navy’s Bureau of Medicine and Surgery (BUMED) in strategic decision support through operations analysis to ensure medical forces ready for global contingency operations. These activities require careful and meticulous planning and analysis to balance programming limitations, operational demands, and unit readiness.
The qualified candidate will be educated and experienced in Operations Research or Mathematics. The qualified candidate blends professional and communication skills with technical analytical tasks using both qualitative and quantitative data. The ideal candidate will possess an advanced degree at least (4) years’ experience in a relevant field, including experience analyzing strategic operational challenges within the Department of Defense. The ideal candidate will possess advanced technical skills in statistical and data analysis and demonstrated ability to use common statistical programming languages (e.g. R, Python, or similar) to support a variety of analytical tasks. The candidate is expected to collect technical requirements, liaise with data owners, manipulate and analyze complex datasets, and provide analysis of results that can be visualized and easily comprehended by non-technical customers. The candidate will produce technical data analysis on several existing workstreams; work with customers to evaluate new requirements; serve as a technical expert capable of clearly explaining technical methodologies in lay terms; deliver technical solutions that meet requirements; and evaluate datasets to creatively explore how they can be developed into new workstreams.

BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

Intelligence & Security (I&S), based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.

At BAE Systems, we celebrate the array of skills, experiences, and perspectives our employees bring to the table. For us, differences are a source of strength. We’re laser-focused on high performance, and we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where all employees can innovate and thrive. Here, you will not only build your career, but you will also enjoy work-life balance, uncover new experiences, and collaborate with passionate colleagues.

Background:
Founded in the mid‐1990’s, Battea – Class Action Services, is the preeminent provider of securities class action recovery services to the institutional investment community. Battea processes detailed historical trade data and efficiently handles filings and collections of class action settlement recoveries on behalf of hedge funds and proprietary trading firms. Through its highly automated Claims Engine technology, Battea provides institutional investors with a full-service, outsourced solution for securities class action claims processing.

The Office of Research and Policy Innovation is the DSS policy analysis, research, and program evaluation unit, informing high-level decision-making across DSS-HRA-DHS. Through rigorous research studies and evaluations, ORPI develops and analyzes the evidence base for HRA and DHS work and provides unbiased recommendations regarding priority issues and initiatives to the NYC Department of Social Services (DSS) Commissioner, the Human Resources Administration (HRA) and Department of Homeless Services (DHS) Administrators, the DSS Chief Program Planning and Financial Management Officer, and HRA and DHS program leadership. ORPI is additionally responsible for providing strategic direction in the development and monitoring of collaborative research and evaluation efforts and grant proposals.

ORPI is recruiting for one (1) City Research Scientist II who will:

Conduct program evaluations of pilot programs and other priority interventions across a wide range of DSS/HRA/DHS program areas—and using a wide range of methods. Evaluation designs include experimental and quasi-experimental impact evaluations, mixed-methods implementation and outcome studies, and cost-benefit analyses.

This is a supervisory role and reports to the PRCR Operations Manager.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Develop, monitor, and oversee the department's annual operating budget (approximately $18 million) including revenue and expenditures;Collect, analyze and interpret financial data;Identify and analyze trends, forecast revenues and expenditures, and highlight areas that require attention and action;Oversee the department’s financial functions, including A/R, AP, and Purchasing;Serve as departmental contact for budget training, development, and troubleshootingCoordinate appropriation transfers and grants for the department;Provide in-depth research and fiscal analysis on special projects for the department;Compile and report financial data for national and local surveys;Respond to budgetary and financial inquiries from Town Council, internal and external auditor, other departments, and citizens;Participate in teams providing cost-benefit analysis and program evaluation to develop viable recommendations;Provide project manager leadership;Act as liaison with the Town’s Finance Department and a representative on departmental and Town-wide committees.BudgetClarifies procedures relative to budgetary matters, revenue estimates, contractual matters, and various pricing models;Develops and implements budget calendar; prepares departmental summaries and coordinates the preparation of all divisions' narratives and performance standards;Reviews department budget inputs prior to submission to budget office for operations and maintenance and Priority Based Budgeting;Provides management/analytical review of all divisions' operating budgets to ensure consistency and appropriateness of the requests; recommends alternative funding methods;Facilitates with division managers for the input and formulation of CIB/P;ContractsInitiates, develops, and writes contractual documents for the department including service agreements, licensing agreements, lease agreements, joint use agreements, memorandums of understanding and design and project agreements; Oversees the development of RFP's for the department;Establishes procedures relative to contract management and ensures conformity of services by the provider, licensees, lessees, entertainers, performers, event promoters, and design and project companies;Oversees contract management and contract administration for the department. Authorizes and approves contracts of the department with reviews for compliance with Town ordinances, policies, statutes, and risk management;Reviews, authorize, and approves requisitions for payments for departmental requirements such as the purchase of goods and services, consulting, design, and constructions projects;Risk ManagementServes as departmental risk management representative and safety coordinator; Reviews employee accidents information and patron accidents. Recommends changes to prevent re-occurrences or to enhance patron safety;Develops and implements procedures for operations and safety of programs, participants, equipment, facilities and assess risk; assesses risk and ensures compliance with established risk management procedures;Additional TasksAnalyzes procedures for facility rentals, recreation programs, instructors, merchandise sales, and inventories;Gathers, formulates, and reviews division inputs for the department to ensure conformity with town guidelines and policies, statutes, employment practices; makes recommendations to division managers and Department Director;Quantifies and makes recommendations on departmental procedures to include reviewing staffing levels, procedures, and financial requirements;Develops recommendations on operational improvements and conducts training on new or revised operations procedures and policies;Oversees grant-related projects and ensures proper procedures for tracking progress, approving payments, and reporting necessary information to the Town's finance department and appropriate grant authority;Handles special projects as assigned and needed; provides information about the department's programs as requested;Reviews and responds to citizen inquiries and complaints;Oversees and manages the Volunteer Background Investigation program for the department;Conducts independent financial internal audits of PRCR facilities to access compliances with cash handling procedures, inventory management, P-Card transactions, petty cash management, and other on-site cash funds as assigned to facilities, employee time input, and approval;Develops and administers policies for the department for document retention. Ensures Department compliance Town and NC Department of Cultural Resources.Performs other job-related tasks as required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Thorough knowledge of department objectives, procedures, and services; thorough knowledge of principles, practices, and techniques of public or business administration; thorough knowledge of operational analysis principles; thorough knowledge of personal computers and related software, especially spreadsheet applications; thorough knowledge of research and analysis methods and techniques; thorough knowledge of public liability and insurance; ability to analyze administrative problems, to make sound recommendations for their solution and to prepare working procedures; ability to communicate ideas effectively both orally and in writing; ability to plan, organize and direct the work of others; ability to organize and plan processes; ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with officials, other employees and the general public; ability to prepare complex records and reports; ability to work independently; ability to apply general knowledge and previous experience to the particular problem and setting of the assignment.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor's degree in business, public administration, or a closely related field and considerable experience at an administrative or policy review level in local government or private sector. A Master's degree in public or business administration is preferred. Physical RequirementsThe work in this class is generally sedentary. An employee must be able to talk and hear in order to be able to communicate with employees, consultants, contractors, and others. Visual acuity is necessary in order to read and write handwritten and typewritten materials and view a computer terminal. Special RequirementsRequires possession of a valid driver's license with an acceptable driving record. Requires drug testing and background check (which may include criminal check, education verification, and credit history review) prior to employment.Requires proof of full COVID-19 vaccination for all new Town of Cary employees. The Town is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and as such, will consider reasonable accommodations as required by law.

Founded in 1985, SelectQuote provides solutions that help consumers protect their most valuable assets: their families, health and property. The company pioneered the model of providing unbiased comparisons from multiple, highly rated insurance companies allowing consumers to choose the policy and terms that best meet their unique needs. Two foundational pillars underpin SelectQuote's success: a strong force of highly trained and skilled agents, who provide consultative needs analysis for every consumer, and proprietary technology that sources and routes high-quality leads. The company has three core business lines: SelectQuote Senior, SelectQuote Life and SelectQuote Auto and Home. SelectQuote Senior, the largest and fastest-growing business, serves the needs of a demographic that sees 10,000 people turn 65 each day with a range of Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement plans.

At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future! SAP Material Master Analyst (2103535) Research Triangle Park, NC preferred Where the Chemistry Happens We are seeking a professional like you to serve as SAP Material Master Data Analyst.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success Leveraging your experience (in areas such as Operations and Supply Chain) and deep knowledge in Material Master Data (especially, understanding of article creation process, material tree structure – BI, PBG, PRD, Article, KOMBI, zBOM) and its impact to downstream processes, you will manage material master data creation and maintenance for both Seeds articles and Chemical articles for the North America Agriculture business. Your strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills will be essential as you foster a service-oriented relationship with internal stakeholders to meet production / product launch expectations by timely creating accurate material master data and resolving master data issues. Your effective written and verbal communication skills will serve you well as you collaborate with respective regional & Global teams to successfully process material master data requests. Using your advanced experience in MS Word, Excel, Sharepoint, MS Teams, you will document regional master data maintenance processes, SOP's, and support maintenance of team folders. Be creative and curious to support quarterly UAT / regression testings and to make sure system changes are fitting well to AP North American business processes. Experience in using SAP is a must. Experience in project management relating to system transition, integration, merger / acquisition, divesture would be a plus. Experience in using automation tools such as VBA scripts would be a plus. Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you—the whole you—in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry. The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career. BASF provides interesting and challenging learning and development opportunities to help you make the most of your talents and your job. JDSAT is an Operations Research and Data Sciences firm currently seeking an enthusiastic, self-driven, and experienced Operations Research Analyst to the US Navy’s Bureau of Medicine and Surgery (BUMED) in strategic decision support through operations analysis to ensure medical forces ready for global contingency operations. These activities require careful and meticulous planning and analysis to balance programming limitations, operational demands, and unit readiness.
The qualified candidate will be educated and experienced in Operations Research or Mathematics. The qualified candidate blends professional and communication skills with technical analytical tasks using both qualitative and quantitative data. The ideal candidate will possess an advanced degree at least (4) years’ experience in a relevant field, including experience analyzing strategic operational challenges within the Department of Defense. The ideal candidate will possess advanced technical skills in statistical and data analysis and demonstrated ability to use common statistical programming languages (e.g. R, Python, or similar) to support a variety of analytical tasks. The candidate is expected to collect technical requirements, liaise with data owners, manipulate and analyze complex datasets, and provide analysis of results that can be visualized and easily comprehended by non-technical customers. The candidate will produce technical data analysis on several existing workstreams; work with customers to evaluate new requirements; serve as a technical expert capable of clearly explaining technical methodologies in lay terms; deliver technical solutions that meet requirements; and evaluate datasets to creatively explore how they can be developed into new workstreams.

BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

Intelligence & Security (I&S), based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.

At BAE Systems, we celebrate the array of skills, experiences, and perspectives our employees bring to the table. For us, differences are a source of strength. We’re laser-focused on high performance, and we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where all employees can innovate and thrive. The Town of Cary is recruiting for a collaborative, innovative, and passionate PRCR Operations Analyst. Cary is focused on creating “The Local Government That Doesn’t Exist” by exceeding standards for how municipalities should operate. We embody excellence and professionalism by demonstrating leading practices and partnering effectively with our community. We are looking for a budget and analysis professional to help us build on our legacy of excellence while recognizing there is always room for growth and innovation. High-performing candidates who are adaptive, ready to engage in problem-solving, dare to think differently, have the technical skills to deliver, and want to make a difference in their community are encouraged to apply. This is a supervisory role and reports to the PRCR Operations Manager.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Develop, monitor, and oversee the department's annual operating budget (approximately $18 million) including revenue and expenditures;Collect, analyze and interpret financial data;Identify and analyze trends, forecast revenues and expenditures, and highlight areas that require attention and action;Oversee the department’s financial functions, including A/R, AP, and Purchasing;Serve as departmental contact for budget training, development, and troubleshootingCoordinate appropriation transfers and grants for the department;Provide in-depth research and fiscal analysis on special projects for the department;Compile and report financial data for national and local surveys;Respond to budgetary and financial inquiries from Town Council, internal and external auditor, other departments, and citizens;Participate in teams providing cost-benefit analysis and program evaluation to develop viable recommendations;Provide project manager leadership;Act as liaison with the Town’s Finance Department and a representative on departmental and Town-wide committees.BudgetClarifies procedures relative to budgetary matters, revenue estimates, contractual matters, and various pricing models;Develops and implements budget calendar; prepares departmental summaries and coordinates the preparation of all divisions' narratives and performance standards;Reviews department budget inputs prior to submission to budget office for operations and maintenance and Priority Based Budgeting;Provides management/analytical review of all divisions' operating budgets to ensure consistency and appropriateness of the requests; recommends alternative funding methods;Facilitates with division managers for the input and formulation of CIB/P;ContractsInitiates, develops, and writes contractual documents for the department including service agreements, licensing agreements, lease agreements, joint use agreements, memorandums of understanding and design and project agreements; Oversees the development of RFP's for the department;Establishes procedures relative to contract management and ensures conformity of services by the provider, licensees, lessees, entertainers, performers, event promoters, and design and project companies;Oversees contract management and contract administration for the department. Authorizes and approves contracts of the department with reviews for compliance with Town ordinances, policies, statutes, and risk management;Reviews, authorize, and approves requisitions for payments for departmental requirements such as the purchase of goods and services, consulting, design, and constructions projects;Risk ManagementServes as departmental risk management representative and safety coordinator; Reviews employee accidents information and patron accidents. Recommends changes to prevent re-occurrences or to enhance patron safety;Develops and implements procedures for operations and safety of programs, participants, equipment, facilities and assess risk; assesses risk and ensures compliance with established risk management procedures;Additional TasksAnalyzes procedures for facility rentals, recreation programs, instructors, merchandise sales, and inventories;Gathers, formulates, and reviews division inputs for the department to ensure conformity with town guidelines and policies, statutes, employment practices; makes recommendations to division managers and Department Director;Quantifies and makes recommendations on departmental procedures to include reviewing staffing levels, procedures, and financial requirements;Develops recommendations on operational improvements and conducts training on new or revised operations procedures and policies;Oversees grant-related projects and ensures proper procedures for tracking progress, approving payments, and reporting necessary information to the Town's finance department and appropriate grant authority;Handles special projects as assigned and needed; provides information about the department's programs as requested;Reviews and responds to citizen inquiries and complaints;Oversees and manages the Volunteer Background Investigation program for the department;Conducts independent financial internal audits of PRCR facilities to access compliances with cash handling procedures, inventory management, P-Card transactions, petty cash management, and other on-site cash funds as assigned to facilities, employee time input, and approval;Develops and administers policies for the department for document retention. Ensures Department compliance Town and NC Department of Cultural Resources.Performs other job-related tasks as required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Thorough knowledge of department objectives, procedures, and services; thorough knowledge of principles, practices, and techniques of public or business administration; thorough knowledge of operational analysis principles; thorough knowledge of personal computers and related software, especially spreadsheet applications; thorough knowledge of research and analysis methods and techniques; thorough knowledge of public liability and insurance; ability to analyze administrative problems, to make sound recommendations for their solution and to prepare working procedures; ability to communicate ideas effectively both orally and in writing; ability to plan, organize and direct the work of others; ability to organize and plan processes; ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with officials, other employees and the general public; ability to prepare complex records and reports; ability to work independently; ability to apply general knowledge and previous experience to the particular problem and setting of the assignment.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor's degree in business, public administration, or a closely related field and considerable experience at an administrative or policy review level in local government or private sector. A Master's degree in public or business administration is preferred. Physical RequirementsThe work in this class is generally sedentary. An employee must be able to talk and hear in order to be able to communicate with employees, consultants, contractors, and others. Visual acuity is necessary in order to read and write handwritten and typewritten materials and view a computer terminal. Special RequirementsRequires possession of a valid driver's license with an acceptable driving record. Requires drug testing and background check (which may include criminal check, education verification, and credit history review) prior to employment.Requires proof of full COVID-19 vaccination for all new Town of Cary employees.
