EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Develop, monitor, and oversee the department's annual operating budget (approximately $18 million) including revenue and expenditures;Collect, analyze and interpret financial data;Identify and analyze trends, forecast revenues and expenditures, and highlight areas that require attention and action;Oversee the department’s financial functions, including A/R, AP, and Purchasing;Serve as departmental contact for budget training, development, and troubleshootingCoordinate appropriation transfers and grants for the department;Provide in-depth research and fiscal analysis on special projects for the department;Compile and report financial data for national and local surveys;Respond to budgetary and financial inquiries from Town Council, internal and external auditor, other departments, and citizens;Participate in teams providing cost-benefit analysis and program evaluation to develop viable recommendations;Provide project manager leadership;Act as liaison with the Town’s Finance Department and a representative on departmental and Town-wide committees.BudgetClarifies procedures relative to budgetary matters, revenue estimates, contractual matters, and various pricing models;Develops and implements budget calendar; prepares departmental summaries and coordinates the preparation of all divisions' narratives and performance standards;Reviews department budget inputs prior to submission to budget office for operations and maintenance and Priority Based Budgeting;Provides management/analytical review of all divisions' operating budgets to ensure consistency and appropriateness of the requests; recommends alternative funding methods;Facilitates with division managers for the input and formulation of CIB/P;ContractsInitiates, develops, and writes contractual documents for the department including service agreements, licensing agreements, lease agreements, joint use agreements, memorandums of understanding and design and project agreements; Oversees the development of RFP's for the department;Establishes procedures relative to contract management and ensures conformity of services by the provider, licensees, lessees, entertainers, performers, event promoters, and design and project companies;Oversees contract management and contract administration for the department. Authorizes and approves contracts of the department with reviews for compliance with Town ordinances, policies, statutes, and risk management;Reviews, authorize, and approves requisitions for payments for departmental requirements such as the purchase of goods and services, consulting, design, and constructions projects;Risk ManagementServes as departmental risk management representative and safety coordinator; Reviews employee accidents information and patron accidents. Recommends changes to prevent re-occurrences or to enhance patron safety;Develops and implements procedures for operations and safety of programs, participants, equipment, facilities and assess risk; assesses risk and ensures compliance with established risk management procedures;Additional TasksAnalyzes procedures for facility rentals, recreation programs, instructors, merchandise sales, and inventories;Gathers, formulates, and reviews division inputs for the department to ensure conformity with town guidelines and policies, statutes, employment practices; makes recommendations to division managers and Department Director;Quantifies and makes recommendations on departmental procedures to include reviewing staffing levels, procedures, and financial requirements;Develops recommendations on operational improvements and conducts training on new or revised operations procedures and policies;Oversees grant-related projects and ensures proper procedures for tracking progress, approving payments, and reporting necessary information to the Town's finance department and appropriate grant authority;Handles special projects as assigned and needed; provides information about the department's programs as requested;Reviews and responds to citizen inquiries and complaints;Oversees and manages the Volunteer Background Investigation program for the department;Conducts independent financial internal audits of PRCR facilities to access compliances with cash handling procedures, inventory management, P-Card transactions, petty cash management, and other on-site cash funds as assigned to facilities, employee time input, and approval;Develops and administers policies for the department for document retention. Job Title: Research Administration Operations Analyst - Hematologic Malignancies (Remote)
Job Description:
About City of Hope

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 6000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.

Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nation's leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment.

Position Summary

The Center for Translational Data Science (CTDS) at the University of Chicago is hiring a Full-Time Technical Business Analyst in Chicago, IL.
About the Department
The Center for Translational Data Science (CTDS) at the University of Chicago is a research center whose mission is to develop the discipline of translational data science to impactful problems in biology, medicine, healthcare, and the environment. We envision a world in which researchers have ready access to the data needed and the tools required to make data driven discoveries that increase our scientific knowledge and improve the quality of life. We architect ecosystems of large-scale commons of research data, computing resources, applications, tools, and services for the broader research community to use data at scale to pursue scientific inquiry and accelerate discovery.

Job Description:
JOB
The Town of Cary requires proof of full COVID-19 vaccination as a condition of employment for any new Town of Cary employees. The Town is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and as such, will consider reasonable accommodations as required by law. The Town of Cary is recruiting for a collaborative, innovative, and passionate PRCR Operations Analyst. Cary is focused on creating “The Local Government That Doesn’t Exist” by exceeding standards for how municipalities should operate. We embody excellence and professionalism by demonstrating leading practices and partnering effectively with our community. We are looking for a budget and analysis professional to help us build on our legacy of excellence while recognizing there is always room for growth and innovation. High-performing candidates who are adaptive, ready to engage in problem-solving, dare to think differently, have the technical skills to deliver, and want to make a difference in their community are encouraged to apply. This is a supervisory role and reports to the PRCR Operations Manager.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Develop, monitor, and oversee the department's annual operating budget (approximately $18 million) including revenue and expenditures;Collect, analyze and interpret financial data;Identify and analyze trends, forecast revenues and expenditures, and highlight areas that require attention and action;Oversee the department’s financial functions, including A/R, AP, and Purchasing;Serve as departmental contact for budget training, development, and troubleshootingCoordinate appropriation transfers and grants for the department;Provide in-depth research and fiscal analysis on special projects for the department;Compile and report financial data for national and local surveys;Respond to budgetary and financial inquiries from Town Council, internal and external auditor, other departments, and citizens;Participate in teams providing cost-benefit analysis and program evaluation to develop viable recommendations;Provide project manager leadership;Act as liaison with the Town’s Finance Department and a representative on departmental and Town-wide committees.BudgetClarifies procedures relative to budgetary matters, revenue estimates, contractual matters, and various pricing models;Develops and implements budget calendar; prepares departmental summaries and coordinates the preparation of all divisions' narratives and performance standards;Reviews department budget inputs prior to submission to budget office for operations and maintenance and Priority Based Budgeting;Provides management/analytical review of all divisions' operating budgets to ensure consistency and appropriateness of the requests; recommends alternative funding methods;Facilitates with division managers for the input and formulation of CIB/P;ContractsInitiates, develops, and writes contractual documents for the department including service agreements, licensing agreements, lease agreements, joint use agreements, memorandums of understanding and design and project agreements; Oversees the development of RFP's for the department;Establishes procedures relative to contract management and ensures conformity of services by the provider, licensees, lessees, entertainers, performers, event promoters, and design and project companies;Oversees contract management and contract administration for the department. Authorizes and approves contracts of the department with reviews for compliance with Town ordinances, policies, statutes, and risk management;Reviews, authorize, and approves requisitions for payments for departmental requirements such as the purchase of goods and services, consulting, design, and constructions projects;Risk ManagementServes as departmental risk management representative and safety coordinator; Reviews employee accidents information and patron accidents. Recommends changes to prevent re-occurrences or to enhance patron safety;Develops and implements procedures for operations and safety of programs, participants, equipment, facilities and assess risk; assesses risk and ensures compliance with established risk management procedures;Additional TasksAnalyzes procedures for facility rentals, recreation programs, instructors, merchandise sales, and inventories;Gathers, formulates, and reviews division inputs for the department to ensure conformity with town guidelines and policies, statutes, employment practices; makes recommendations to division managers and Department Director;Quantifies and makes recommendations on departmental procedures to include reviewing staffing levels, procedures, and financial requirements;Develops recommendations on operational improvements and conducts training on new or revised operations procedures and policies;Oversees grant-related projects and ensures proper procedures for tracking progress, approving payments, and reporting necessary information to the Town's finance department and appropriate grant authority;Handles special projects as assigned and needed; provides information about the department's programs as requested;Reviews and responds to citizen inquiries and complaints;Oversees and manages the Volunteer Background Investigation program for the department;Conducts independent financial internal audits of PRCR facilities to access compliances with cash handling procedures, inventory management, P-Card transactions, petty cash management, and other on-site cash funds as assigned to facilities, employee time input, and approval;Develops and administers policies for the department for document retention. Ensures Department compliance Town and NC Department of Cultural Resources.Performs other job-related tasks as required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Thorough knowledge of department objectives, procedures, and services; thorough knowledge of principles, practices, and techniques of public or business administration; thorough knowledge of operational analysis principles; thorough knowledge of personal computers and related software, especially spreadsheet applications; thorough knowledge of research and analysis methods and techniques; thorough knowledge of public liability and insurance; ability to analyze administrative problems, to make sound recommendations for their solution and to prepare working procedures; ability to communicate ideas effectively both orally and in writing; ability to plan, organize and direct the work of others; ability to organize and plan processes; ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with officials, other employees and the general public; ability to prepare complex records and reports; ability to work independently; ability to apply general knowledge and previous experience to the particular problem and setting of the assignment.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor's degree in business, public administration, or a closely related field and considerable experience at an administrative or policy review level in local government or private sector. A Master's degree in public or business administration is preferred. Physical RequirementsThe work in this class is generally sedentary. An employee must be able to talk and hear in order to be able to communicate with employees, consultants, contractors, and others. Visual acuity is necessary in order to read and write handwritten and typewritten materials and view a computer terminal. The All of Us Research Program is an NIH funded national initiative that seeks to enroll one million people living in the United States in a 10 year longitudinal study, and takes into account an individual's variability in genes, environment, and lifestyle. The goal of the program is to help researchers learn more about what affects people's health. The program will give new information and tools to people researching health. Their discoveries may lead to more personalized care and treatments. The Community Health Center, Inc. was awarded a grant to be part of the Health Provider Organizations that enroll patients into the program.
Community Health Center, Inc. is seeking a Jr. EHR Business Application Analyst to support the electronic applications and data management related to its participation in the National Institute for Health's All of Us Research Program (AoURP). The Business Applications Analyst (BAA) is primarily responsible for supporting the electronic applications and data used in the All of Us Research Program, which includes Quickbase and EHR applications. The BAA is responsible for ensuring data integrity for reporting requirements, and works closely with the AoURP staff on collecting data, developing reports, and supporting the secure sharing of electronic health records with the NIH AoURP data repository. The BAA acts as a liaison between the AoURP program staff, and internal and external partners. The BAA provides outstanding client service and contributes to the organization's mission of utilizing information technology to improve the business operations that promote CHCI's participation in the AoURP.

Job Summary:

JOB
The Town of Cary requires proof of full COVID-19 vaccination as a condition of employment for any new Town of Cary employees. The Town is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and as such, will consider reasonable accommodations as required by law. The Town of Cary is recruiting for a collaborative, innovative, and passionate PRCR Operations Analyst. Cary is focused on creating “The Local Government That Doesn’t Exist” by exceeding standards for how municipalities should operate. We embody excellence and professionalism by demonstrating leading practices and partnering effectively with our community. We are looking for a budget and analysis professional to help us build on our legacy of excellence while recognizing there is always room for growth and innovation. High-performing candidates who are adaptive, ready to engage in problem-solving, dare to think differently, have the technical skills to deliver, and want to make a difference in their community are encouraged to apply. This is a supervisory role and reports to the PRCR Operations Manager.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Develop, monitor, and oversee the department's annual operating budget (approximately $18 million) including revenue and expenditures;Collect, analyze and interpret financial data;Identify and analyze trends, forecast revenues and expenditures, and highlight areas that require attention and action;Oversee the department’s financial functions, including A/R, AP, and Purchasing;Serve as departmental contact for budget training, development, and troubleshootingCoordinate appropriation transfers and grants for the department;Provide in-depth research and fiscal analysis on special projects for the department;Compile and report financial data for national and local surveys;Respond to budgetary and financial inquiries from Town Council, internal and external auditor, other departments, and citizens;Participate in teams providing cost-benefit analysis and program evaluation to develop viable recommendations;Provide project manager leadership;Act as liaison with the Town’s Finance Department and a representative on departmental and Town-wide committees.BudgetClarifies procedures relative to budgetary matters, revenue estimates, contractual matters, and various pricing models;Develops and implements budget calendar; prepares departmental summaries and coordinates the preparation of all divisions' narratives and performance standards;Reviews department budget inputs prior to submission to budget office for operations and maintenance and Priority Based Budgeting;Provides management/analytical review of all divisions' operating budgets to ensure consistency and appropriateness of the requests; recommends alternative funding methods;Facilitates with division managers for the input and formulation of CIB/P;ContractsInitiates, develops, and writes contractual documents for the department including service agreements, licensing agreements, lease agreements, joint use agreements, memorandums of understanding and design and project agreements; Oversees the development of RFP's for the department;Establishes procedures relative to contract management and ensures conformity of services by the provider, licensees, lessees, entertainers, performers, event promoters, and design and project companies;Oversees contract management and contract administration for the department. Authorizes and approves contracts of the department with reviews for compliance with Town ordinances, policies, statutes, and risk management;Reviews, authorize, and approves requisitions for payments for departmental requirements such as the purchase of goods and services, consulting, design, and constructions projects;Risk ManagementServes as departmental risk management representative and safety coordinator; Reviews employee accidents information and patron accidents. Recommends changes to prevent re-occurrences or to enhance patron safety;Develops and implements procedures for operations and safety of programs, participants, equipment, facilities and assess risk; assesses risk and ensures compliance with established risk management procedures;Additional TasksAnalyzes procedures for facility rentals, recreation programs, instructors, merchandise sales, and inventories;Gathers, formulates, and reviews division inputs for the department to ensure conformity with town guidelines and policies, statutes, employment practices; makes recommendations to division managers and Department Director;Quantifies and makes recommendations on departmental procedures to include reviewing staffing levels, procedures, and financial requirements;Develops recommendations on operational improvements and conducts training on new or revised operations procedures and policies;Oversees grant-related projects and ensures proper procedures for tracking progress, approving payments, and reporting necessary information to the Town's finance department and appropriate grant authority;Handles special projects as assigned and needed; provides information about the department's programs as requested;Reviews and responds to citizen inquiries and complaints;Oversees and manages the Volunteer Background Investigation program for the department;Conducts independent financial internal audits of PRCR facilities to access compliances with cash handling procedures, inventory management, P-Card transactions, petty cash management, and other on-site cash funds as assigned to facilities, employee time input, and approval;Develops and administers policies for the department for document retention. Ensures Department compliance Town and NC Department of Cultural Resources.Performs other job-related tasks as required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Thorough knowledge of department objectives, procedures, and services; thorough knowledge of principles, practices, and techniques of public or business administration; thorough knowledge of operational analysis principles; thorough knowledge of personal computers and related software, especially spreadsheet applications; thorough knowledge of research and analysis methods and techniques; thorough knowledge of public liability and insurance; ability to analyze administrative problems, to make sound recommendations for their solution and to prepare working procedures; ability to communicate ideas effectively both orally and in writing; ability to plan, organize and direct the work of others; ability to organize and plan processes; ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with officials, other employees and the general public; ability to prepare complex records and reports; ability to work independently; ability to apply general knowledge and previous experience to the particular problem and setting of the assignment.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor's degree in business, public administration, or a closely related field and considerable experience at an administrative or policy review level in local government or private sector. A Master's degree in public or business administration is preferred. Physical RequirementsThe work in this class is generally sedentary. An employee must be able to talk and hear in order to be able to communicate with employees, consultants, contractors, and others. The ideal candidate finds doing qualitative analysis intellectually stimulating, especially when the right or wrong answer is difficult to discern, and finds reading and writing about business strategy, operations and performance thought-provoking. They consider taking ownership of their work, developing analytical skills, and sharing their expertise with others as important measures of success.
Business Intelligence Advisors, Inc. (“BIA”) is an independent investment research firm that provides a unique edge to institutional investors and hedge funds. BIA uses its proprietary behavioral assessment methodology, developed by U.S. intelligence professionals, to critically analyze the language and behaviors from company disclosures to ascertain for investors when management teams are conveying incomplete and unreliable information.

The All of Us Research Program is an NIH funded national initiative that seeks to enroll one million people living in the United States in a 10 year longitudinal study, and takes into account an individual's variability in genes, environment, and lifestyle. The goal of the program is to help researchers learn more about what affects people's health. The program will give new information and tools to people researching health. Their discoveries may lead to more personalized care and treatments. The Community Health Center, Inc. was awarded a grant to be part of the Health Provider Organizations that enroll patients into the program.
Community Health Center, Inc. is seeking a Jr. EHR Business Application Analyst to support the electronic applications and data management related to its participation in the National Institute for Health's All of Us Research Program (AoURP). The Business Applications Analyst (BAA) is primarily responsible for supporting the electronic applications and data used in the All of Us Research Program, which includes Quickbase and EHR applications. The BAA is responsible for ensuring data integrity for reporting requirements, and works closely with the AoURP staff on collecting data, developing reports, and supporting the secure sharing of electronic health records with the NIH AoURP data repository. The BAA acts as a liaison between the AoURP program staff, and internal and external partners. The BAA provides outstanding client service and contributes to the organization's mission of utilizing information technology to improve the business operations that promote CHCI's participation in the AoURP.

JOB
The Town of Cary requires proof of full COVID-19 vaccination as a condition of employment for any new Town of Cary employees. The Town is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and as such, will consider reasonable accommodations as required by law. The Town of Cary is recruiting for a collaborative, innovative, and passionate PRCR Operations Analyst. Cary is focused on creating “The Local Government That Doesn’t Exist” by exceeding standards for how municipalities should operate. We embody excellence and professionalism by demonstrating leading practices and partnering effectively with our community. We are looking for a budget and analysis professional to help us build on our legacy of excellence while recognizing there is always room for growth and innovation. High-performing candidates who are adaptive, ready to engage in problem-solving, dare to think differently, have the technical skills to deliver, and want to make a difference in their community are encouraged to apply. This is a supervisory role and reports to the PRCR Operations Manager.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Develop, monitor, and oversee the department's annual operating budget (approximately $18 million) including revenue and expenditures;Collect, analyze and interpret financial data;Identify and analyze trends, forecast revenues and expenditures, and highlight areas that require attention and action;Oversee the department’s financial functions, including A/R, AP, and Purchasing;Serve as departmental contact for budget training, development, and troubleshootingCoordinate appropriation transfers and grants for the department;Provide in-depth research and fiscal analysis on special projects for the department;Compile and report financial data for national and local surveys;Respond to budgetary and financial inquiries from Town Council, internal and external auditor, other departments, and citizens;Participate in teams providing cost-benefit analysis and program evaluation to develop viable recommendations;Provide project manager leadership;Act as liaison with the Town’s Finance Department and a representative on departmental and Town-wide committees.BudgetClarifies procedures relative to budgetary matters, revenue estimates, contractual matters, and various pricing models;Develops and implements budget calendar; prepares departmental summaries and coordinates the preparation of all divisions' narratives and performance standards;Reviews department budget inputs prior to submission to budget office for operations and maintenance and Priority Based Budgeting;Provides management/analytical review of all divisions' operating budgets to ensure consistency and appropriateness of the requests; recommends alternative funding methods;Facilitates with division managers for the input and formulation of CIB/P;ContractsInitiates, develops, and writes contractual documents for the department including service agreements, licensing agreements, lease agreements, joint use agreements, memorandums of understanding and design and project agreements; Oversees the development of RFP's for the department;Establishes procedures relative to contract management and ensures conformity of services by the provider, licensees, lessees, entertainers, performers, event promoters, and design and project companies;Oversees contract management and contract administration for the department. Authorizes and approves contracts of the department with reviews for compliance with Town ordinances, policies, statutes, and risk management;Reviews, authorize, and approves requisitions for payments for departmental requirements such as the purchase of goods and services, consulting, design, and constructions projects;Risk ManagementServes as departmental risk management representative and safety coordinator; Reviews employee accidents information and patron accidents. Recommends changes to prevent re-occurrences or to enhance patron safety;Develops and implements procedures for operations and safety of programs, participants, equipment, facilities and assess risk; assesses risk and ensures compliance with established risk management procedures;Additional TasksAnalyzes procedures for facility rentals, recreation programs, instructors, merchandise sales, and inventories;Gathers, formulates, and reviews division inputs for the department to ensure conformity with town guidelines and policies, statutes, employment practices; makes recommendations to division managers and Department Director;Quantifies and makes recommendations on departmental procedures to include reviewing staffing levels, procedures, and financial requirements;Develops recommendations on operational improvements and conducts training on new or revised operations procedures and policies;Oversees grant-related projects and ensures proper procedures for tracking progress, approving payments, and reporting necessary information to the Town's finance department and appropriate grant authority;Handles special projects as assigned and needed; provides information about the department's programs as requested;Reviews and responds to citizen inquiries and complaints;Oversees and manages the Volunteer Background Investigation program for the department;Conducts independent financial internal audits of PRCR facilities to access compliances with cash handling procedures, inventory management, P-Card transactions, petty cash management, and other on-site cash funds as assigned to facilities, employee time input, and approval;Develops and administers policies for the department for document retention. Ensures Department compliance Town and NC Department of Cultural Resources.Performs other job-related tasks as required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Thorough knowledge of department objectives, procedures, and services; thorough knowledge of principles, practices, and techniques of public or business administration; thorough knowledge of operational analysis principles; thorough knowledge of personal computers and related software, especially spreadsheet applications; thorough knowledge of research and analysis methods and techniques; thorough knowledge of public liability and insurance; ability to analyze administrative problems, to make sound recommendations for their solution and to prepare working procedures; ability to communicate ideas effectively both orally and in writing; ability to plan, organize and direct the work of others; ability to organize and plan processes; ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with officials, other employees and the general public; ability to prepare complex records and reports; ability to work independently; ability to apply general knowledge and previous experience to the particular problem and setting of the assignment.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor's degree in business, public administration, or a closely related field and considerable experience at an administrative or policy review level in local government or private sector. A Master's degree in public or business administration is preferred. Physical RequirementsThe work in this class is generally sedentary. An employee must be able to talk and hear in order to be able to communicate with employees, consultants, contractors, and others. Visual acuity is necessary in order to read and write handwritten and typewritten materials and view a computer terminal. Special RequirementsRequires possession of a valid driver's license with an acceptable driving record. Requires drug testing and background check (which may include criminal check, education verification, and credit history review) prior to employment.Requires proof of full COVID-19 vaccination for all new Town of Cary employees. The Town is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and as such, will consider reasonable accommodations as required by law.

Founded in 1985, SelectQuote provides solutions that help consumers protect their most valuable assets: their families, health and property. Two foundational pillars underpin SelectQuote's success: a strong force of highly trained and skilled agents, who provide consultative needs analysis for every consumer, and proprietary technology that sources and routes high-quality leads. The company has three core business lines: SelectQuote Senior, SelectQuote Life and SelectQuote Auto and Home. SelectQuote Senior, the largest and fastest-growing business, serves the needs of a demographic that sees 10,000 people turn 65 each day with a range of Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement plans.

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 6,000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer, type 1 diabetes, type 2 diabetes and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.

City of Hope has one of the most influential type 1 and type 2 diabetes research programs in the world. JDSAT is an Operations Research and Data Sciences firm currently seeking an enthusiastic, self-driven, and experienced Operations Research Analyst to the US Navy’s Bureau of Medicine and Surgery (BUMED) in strategic decision support through operations analysis to ensure medical forces ready for global contingency operations. These activities require careful and meticulous planning and analysis to balance programming limitations, operational demands, and unit readiness.
The qualified candidate will be educated and experienced in Operations Research or Mathematics. The qualified candidate blends professional and communication skills with technical analytical tasks using both qualitative and quantitative data. The ideal candidate will possess an advanced degree at least (4) years’ experience in a relevant field, including experience analyzing strategic operational challenges within the Department of Defense. The ideal candidate will possess advanced technical skills in statistical and data analysis and demonstrated ability to use common statistical programming languages (e.g. R, Python, or similar) to support a variety of analytical tasks. The candidate is expected to collect technical requirements, liaise with data owners, manipulate and analyze complex datasets, and provide analysis of results that can be visualized and easily comprehended by non-technical customers. The candidate will produce technical data analysis on several existing workstreams; work with customers to evaluate new requirements; serve as a technical expert capable of clearly explaining technical methodologies in lay terms; deliver technical solutions that meet requirements; and evaluate datasets to creatively explore how they can be developed into new workstreams.

Founded in 1985, SelectQuote provides solutions that help consumers protect their most valuable assets: their families, health and property. The company pioneered the model of providing unbiased comparisons from multiple, highly rated insurance companies allowing consumers to choose the policy and terms that best meet their unique needs. Two foundational pillars underpin SelectQuote's success: a strong force of highly trained and skilled agents, who provide consultative needs analysis for every consumer, and proprietary technology that sources and routes high-quality leads. The company has three core business lines: SelectQuote Senior, SelectQuote Life and SelectQuote Auto and Home. SelectQuote Senior, the largest and fastest-growing business, serves the needs of a demographic that sees 10,000 people turn 65 each day with a range of Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement plans.

About City of Hope

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 6,000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer, type 1 diabetes, type 2 diabetes and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.

City of Hope has one of the most influential type 1 and type 2 diabetes research programs in the world. Our scientists' work has revolutionized the understanding and treatment of the disease and continues today with exciting developments in cell transplantation, gene regulation, immune tolerance and gaining systemic understanding of diabetes as a complex, multifaceted disease.

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 6000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.

Job Description:
The All of Us Research Program is an NIH funded national initiative that seeks to enroll one million people living in the United States in a 10 year longitudinal study, and takes into account an individual's variability in genes, environment, and lifestyle. The goal of the program is to help researchers learn more about what affects people's health. The program will give new information and tools to people researching health. Their discoveries may lead to more personalized care and treatments. The Community Health Center, Inc. was awarded a grant to be part of the Health Provider Organizations that enroll patients into the program.
Community Health Center, Inc. is seeking a Jr. EHR Business Application Analyst to support the electronic applications and data management related to its participation in the National Institute for Health's All of Us Research Program (AoURP). The Business Applications Analyst (BAA) is primarily responsible for supporting the electronic applications and data used in the All of Us Research Program, which includes Quickbase and EHR applications. The BAA is responsible for ensuring data integrity for reporting requirements, and works closely with the AoURP staff on collecting data, developing reports, and supporting the secure sharing of electronic health records with the NIH AoURP data repository. The BAA acts as a liaison between the AoURP program staff, and internal and external partners. The BAA provides outstanding client service and contributes to the organization's mission of utilizing information technology to improve the business operations that promote CHCI's participation in the AoURP.

Job Title: Research Analyst – Qualitative Behavioral Investment Insights

Research Analyst – Qualitative Behavioral Investment Insights
The ideal candidate finds doing qualitative analysis intellectually stimulating, especially when the right or wrong answer is difficult to discern, and finds reading and writing about business strategy, operations and performance thought-provoking. They consider taking ownership of their work, developing analytical skills, and sharing their expertise with others as important measures of success.
Business Intelligence Advisors, Inc. (“BIA”) is an independent investment research firm that provides a unique edge to institutional investors and hedge funds. BIA uses its proprietary behavioral assessment methodology, developed by U.S. intelligence professionals, to critically analyze the language and behaviors from company disclosures to ascertain for investors when management teams are conveying incomplete and unreliable information.

Two foundational pillars underpin SelectQuote's success: a strong force of highly trained and skilled agents, who provide consultative needs analysis for every consumer, and proprietary technology that sources and routes high-quality leads. The company has three core business lines: SelectQuote Senior, SelectQuote Life and SelectQuote Auto and Home. SelectQuote Senior, the largest and fastest-growing business, serves the needs of a demographic that sees 10,000 people turn 65 each day with a range of Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement plans.

We embrace a cleaner and leaner utility vision focused on eliminating energy waste and adding renewable energy from sources such as wind and solar.
At Consumers Energy, we offer more than just a place to work. We foster a culture that supports career development, growth, and stability, and we take pride in offering our co-workers excellent benefits and compensation packages. We are deliberately creating an inclusive culture that makes our diverse team of co-workers feel valued, supported, and empowered every day. We're a company made up of thousands of people, all with different stories to share and work to do, but we stand united in our company purpose: world class performance delivering hometown service.

About City of Hope

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 6000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.

Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nation's leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment.

Under minimal supervision the Sr. Research Operations Analyst (SRO) supports daily operations within the department; independently assists with pre and post award activities including budget preparation, proposals, analysis, and project close out. Applies system and analytical thinking methodology and discipline.

Job Description:
Grow with us! Through training, teamwork, and exposure to challenging technical work, let Leidos show you how to accelerate your career path.
The Defense Group at Leidos currently has an opening for an Operations Intelligence Analyst to work in a customer facility at MacDill AFB, Tampa, FL. This program requires a seasoned, mature professional with prior experience working in higher echelons of military headquarters, experience in handling sensitive information and independent decision making. Must be capable of working as a member of a highly skilled team to accomplish time sensitive, critical tasks. Must be capable of receiving, analyzing, and interpreting general guidance and direction from program leadership to act independently to changing situations.

Candidate will conduct research, create intelligence reports, create assessments, and conduct intelligence briefings on request. Collect, analyze, interpret, evaluate, and integrate complex data from multiple sources to assess relevance and significance of developments in his/her assigned subject matter and geographic area. Attend and participate in conferences and other events as directed. Support management of information, presentation of information, and production of graphics, as well as monitoring multiple intelligence systems. Support future capabilities and technologies efforts. Identify intelligence gaps and recommend requirements to fill. Maintain contact with counterparts in other organizations.


Required Education, Experience, & Skills
Requires 10+ years of relevant, demonstrated experience. Must possess strong GEOINT and Multi-INT experience with a background in China analysis. Excellent research, writing, and briefing skills to customer senior leadership, as they pertain to an intelligence environment supporting critical operations. Experience in augmenting cross-functional, Multi-INT discipline analysis teams, providing situational awareness, intelligence production and analysis for high interest and threats. Experienced in conducting research, creating intelligence products, intelligence estimates assessments, and providing intelligence briefings as requested. expertise in collection, analysis, interpretation, evaluation and integrating complex data from multiple sources to assess relevancy and significance of development for assigned subject matter and geographic areas. experience in collection, analysis, interpretation evaluation, and research utilizing Open Source tools, techniques, methodology, and software.


Customer is requesting a seasoned Intelligence Analyst preferably with multi-INT expertise.
BS degree in GIS, Geography, Intelligence studies, International relations, or related degrees desirable. Expertise in ISIL.

Job Title: Senior Knowledge Analyst- Digital Operations in Consumer Products
Job Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO
As a Senior Knowledge Analyst (SKA) within BCG's Consumer Practice Area Knowledge Team, you will work in a growing global team, providing industry and functional expertise and insights in Consumer Products Digital Operations whilst working together with case and proposal teams to provide knowledge assets, analysis and expert advisory. In addition, you will support business development and go-to-market efforts, by working with proposal teams, to ensure that they have access to our latest content, and approaches. You’ll serve as a thought partner and content expert to case teams and topic/sector leaders, helping structure and solve complex issues.

Additionally, you will support the Consumer Products Operations topic leadership in developing existing & new intellectual property and knowledge assets. You will work on commercialization efforts In CPG Operations, in conjunction with business leaders. You will support marketing efforts, including conference event presentations and publications. As a Senior Knowledge Analyst you will support and guide consulting staff in selecting the right research approaches, tools and analyses; assist case teams in navigating the Knowledge network and in connecting with relevant materials and people. We are seeking a candidate experienced with the evolving digital tools and capabilities and how they can drive supply chain and manufacturing performance at our clients.

The candidate is expected to have knowledge in at least two or more of the following topics: Digital Supply Chain, Sustainability in Operations, Ecommerce supply chain, Procurement, Supply Chain Sustainability, and Manufacturing & SC Strategy.

BCG’s Consumer Practice is one of the firm's largest industry practice areas and keeps growing
continuously across all regions. BCG’s Consumer practice creates breakthrough innovations for clients in the four sectors: consumer goods, retail, fashion & luxury and travel & tourism.
The ideal candidate will have passion for the Consumer Products sector and enjoy working across multiple cases and stakeholders. Key personal attributes that are required to be successful in the role are:
As a Senior Knowledge Analyst you will collaborate with global topic leads and colleagues across BCG to bring expertise and capabilities to the service of our internal and external clients. Our team is made up of a diverse pool of knowledge positions that allow us to pursue exciting, innovative knowledge careers.
The Knowledge Team (KT) is a group of functional and/or industry experts leveraging deep domain knowledge to enable insight for case teams and clients. KT members are affiliated to BCG Practice Areas, plugged into the strategic agenda and building and deploying leading edge IP data tools/assets to deliver insight.

BCG's Knowledge Team members support cases through deep project engagement or even staffing and help co-create insights with case teams and clients through expert perspectives on industry trends, delivery of proprietary data or tools in a particular function and complex research and analysis of market information. KT members also support the PA’s business development and proposals and help to organize and codify the knowledge that enables BCG to deliver superior business value for its clients.

EMPLOYER PROFILE: MARTA is the 12th largest transit system in the US and North America that provides bus and rail services and we are one of a small group of transit agencies with a full-service in-house research department. MARTA is committed to a culture of continuous improvement and setting a higher standard of service delivery. We are transforming our operations to deliver a world class transit experience.

The Department of Research and Analysis is seeking to hire a Senior Performance Analyst with a Consumer Research Focus. You will be responsible for our primary ongoing research projects and custom projects with a focus on research design, sampling, statistical analysis / data modeling, and communicating insights through storytelling in a persuasive, actionable, impactful manner.

Job Description:
Grow with us! Through training, teamwork, and exposure to challenging technical work, let Leidos show you how to accelerate your career path.
The Defense Group at Leidos currently has an opening for an Operations Intelligence Analyst to work in a customer facility at MacDill AFB, Tampa, FL. This program requires a seasoned, mature professional with prior experience working in higher echelons of military headquarters, experience in handling sensitive information and independent decision making. Must be capable of working as a member of a highly skilled team to accomplish time sensitive, critical tasks. Must be capable of receiving, analyzing, and interpreting general guidance and direction from program leadership to act independently to changing situations.

Candidate will conduct research, create intelligence reports, create assessments, and conduct intelligence briefings on request. Collect, analyze, interpret, evaluate, and integrate complex data from multiple sources to assess relevance and significance of developments in his/her assigned subject matter and geographic area. Attend and participate in conferences and other events as directed. Support management of information, presentation of information, and production of graphics, as well as monitoring multiple intelligence systems. Support future capabilities and technologies efforts. Identify intelligence gaps and recommend requirements to fill. Maintain contact with counterparts in other organizations.


Required Education, Experience, & Skills
Requires 10+ years of relevant, demonstrated experience. Must possess strong GEOINT and Multi-INT experience with a background in China analysis. Excellent research, writing, and briefing skills to customer senior leadership, as they pertain to an intelligence environment supporting critical operations. Experience in augmenting cross-functional, Multi-INT discipline analysis teams, providing situational awareness, intelligence production and analysis for high interest and threats. Experienced in conducting research, creating intelligence products, intelligence estimates assessments, and providing intelligence briefings as requested. expertise in collection, analysis, interpretation, evaluation and integrating complex data from multiple sources to assess relevancy and significance of development for assigned subject matter and geographic areas. experience in collection, analysis, interpretation evaluation, and research utilizing Open Source tools, techniques, methodology, and software.


Customer is requesting a seasoned Intelligence Analyst preferably with multi-INT expertise.
BS degree in GIS, Geography, Intelligence studies, International relations, or related degrees desirable. Expertise in ISIL.

Job Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO
As a Senior Knowledge Analyst (SKA) within BCG's Consumer Practice Area Knowledge Team, you will work in a growing global team, providing industry and functional expertise and insights in Consumer Products Digital Operations whilst working together with case and proposal teams to provide knowledge assets, analysis and expert advisory. In addition, you will support business development and go-to-market efforts, by working with proposal teams, to ensure that they have access to our latest content, and approaches. You’ll serve as a thought partner and content expert to case teams and topic/sector leaders, helping structure and solve complex issues.

Additionally, you will support the Consumer Products Operations topic leadership in developing existing & new intellectual property and knowledge assets. You will work on commercialization efforts In CPG Operations, in conjunction with business leaders. You will support marketing efforts, including conference event presentations and publications. As a Senior Knowledge Analyst you will support and guide consulting staff in selecting the right research approaches, tools and analyses; assist case teams in navigating the Knowledge network and in connecting with relevant materials and people. We are seeking a candidate experienced with the evolving digital tools and capabilities and how they can drive supply chain and manufacturing performance at our clients.

The candidate is expected to have knowledge in at least two or more of the following topics: Digital Supply Chain, Sustainability in Operations, Ecommerce supply chain, Procurement, Supply Chain Sustainability, and Manufacturing & SC Strategy.

BCG’s Consumer Practice is one of the firm's largest industry practice areas and keeps growing
continuously across all regions. BCG’s Consumer practice creates breakthrough innovations for clients in the four sectors: consumer goods, retail, fashion & luxury and travel & tourism.
The ideal candidate will have passion for the Consumer Products sector and enjoy working across multiple cases and stakeholders. Key personal attributes that are required to be successful in the role are:
As a Senior Knowledge Analyst you will collaborate with global topic leads and colleagues across BCG to bring expertise and capabilities to the service of our internal and external clients. Our team is made up of a diverse pool of knowledge positions that allow us to pursue exciting, innovative knowledge careers.
The Knowledge Team (KT) is a group of functional and/or industry experts leveraging deep domain knowledge to enable insight for case teams and clients. KT members are affiliated to BCG Practice Areas, plugged into the strategic agenda and building and deploying leading edge IP data tools/assets to deliver insight.

BCG's Knowledge Team members support cases through deep project engagement or even staffing and help co-create insights with case teams and clients through expert perspectives on industry trends, delivery of proprietary data or tools in a particular function and complex research and analysis of market information. KT members also support the PA’s business development and proposals and help to organize and codify the knowledge that enables BCG to deliver superior business value for its clients.

Job Description:
Grow with us! Through training, teamwork, and exposure to challenging technical work, let Leidos show you how to accelerate your career path.
The Defense Group at Leidos currently has an opening for an Operations Intelligence Analyst to work in a customer facility at MacDill AFB, Tampa, FL. This program requires a seasoned, mature professional with prior experience working in higher echelons of military headquarters, experience in handling sensitive information and independent decision making. Must be capable of working as a member of a highly skilled team to accomplish time sensitive, critical tasks. Must be capable of receiving, analyzing, and interpreting general guidance and direction from program leadership to act independently to changing situations.

Candidate will conduct research, create intelligence reports, create assessments, and conduct intelligence briefings on request. Collect, analyze, interpret, evaluate, and integrate complex data from multiple sources to assess relevance and significance of developments in his/her assigned subject matter and geographic area. Attend and participate in conferences and other events as directed. Support management of information, presentation of information, and production of graphics, as well as monitoring multiple intelligence systems. Support future capabilities and technologies efforts. Identify intelligence gaps and recommend requirements to fill. Maintain contact with counterparts in other organizations.


Required Education, Experience, & Skills
Requires 10+ years of relevant, demonstrated experience. Must possess strong GEOINT and Multi-INT experience with a background in China analysis. Excellent research, writing, and briefing skills to customer senior leadership, as they pertain to an intelligence environment supporting critical operations. Experience in augmenting cross-functional, Multi-INT discipline analysis teams, providing situational awareness, intelligence production and analysis for high interest and threats. Experienced in conducting research, creating intelligence products, intelligence estimates assessments, and providing intelligence briefings as requested. expertise in collection, analysis, interpretation, evaluation and integrating complex data from multiple sources to assess relevancy and significance of development for assigned subject matter and geographic areas. experience in collection, analysis, interpretation evaluation, and research utilizing Open Source tools, techniques, methodology, and software.


Customer is requesting a seasoned Intelligence Analyst preferably with multi-INT expertise.
BS degree in GIS, Geography, Intelligence studies, International relations, or related degrees desirable. Expertise in ISIL.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
As a Senior Knowledge Analyst (SKA) within BCG's Consumer Practice Area Knowledge Team, you will work in a growing global team, providing industry and functional expertise and insights in Consumer Products Digital Operations whilst working together with case and proposal teams to provide knowledge assets, analysis and expert advisory. In addition, you will support business development and go-to-market efforts, by working with proposal teams, to ensure that they have access to our latest content, and approaches. You’ll serve as a thought partner and content expert to case teams and topic/sector leaders, helping structure and solve complex issues.

Additionally, you will support the Consumer Products Operations topic leadership in developing existing & new intellectual property and knowledge assets. You will work on commercialization efforts In CPG Operations, in conjunction with business leaders. You will support marketing efforts, including conference event presentations and publications. As a Senior Knowledge Analyst you will support and guide consulting staff in selecting the right research approaches, tools and analyses; assist case teams in navigating the Knowledge network and in connecting with relevant materials and people. We are seeking a candidate experienced with the evolving digital tools and capabilities and how they can drive supply chain and manufacturing performance at our clients.

The candidate is expected to have knowledge in at least two or more of the following topics: Digital Supply Chain, Sustainability in Operations, Ecommerce supply chain, Procurement, Supply Chain Sustainability, and Manufacturing & SC Strategy.

BCG’s Consumer Practice is one of the firm's largest industry practice areas and keeps growing
continuously across all regions. BCG’s Consumer practice creates breakthrough innovations for clients in the four sectors: consumer goods, retail, fashion & luxury and travel & tourism.
The ideal candidate will have passion for the Consumer Products sector and enjoy working across multiple cases and stakeholders. Key personal attributes that are required to be successful in the role are:
As a Senior Knowledge Analyst you will collaborate with global topic leads and colleagues across BCG to bring expertise and capabilities to the service of our internal and external clients. Our team is made up of a diverse pool of knowledge positions that allow us to pursue exciting, innovative knowledge careers.
The Knowledge Team (KT) is a group of functional and/or industry experts leveraging deep domain knowledge to enable insight for case teams and clients. KT members are affiliated to BCG Practice Areas, plugged into the strategic agenda and building and deploying leading edge IP data tools/assets to deliver insight.

BCG's Knowledge Team members support cases through deep project engagement or even staffing and help co-create insights with case teams and clients through expert perspectives on industry trends, delivery of proprietary data or tools in a particular function and complex research and analysis of market information. KT members also support the PA’s business development and proposals and help to organize and codify the knowledge that enables BCG to deliver superior business value for its clients.

Two foundational pillars underpin SelectQuote's success: a strong force of highly trained and skilled agents, who provide consultative needs analysis for every consumer, and proprietary technology that sources and routes high-quality leads. The company has three core business lines: SelectQuote Senior, SelectQuote Life and SelectQuote Auto and Home. SelectQuote Senior, the largest and fastest-growing business, serves the needs of a demographic that sees 10,000 people turn 65 each day with a range of Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement plans.

Join the diverse and dynamic team that powers Michigan's largest energy provider and one of the nation's largest gas and electric combination utilities. Consumers Energy services 6.7 million of Michigan's 10 million residents - caring for our friends and neighbors in all 68 Lower Peninsula counties. We embrace a cleaner and leaner utility vision focused on eliminating energy waste and adding renewable energy from sources such as wind and solar.
At Consumers Energy, we offer more than just a place to work. We foster a culture that supports career development, growth, and stability, and we take pride in offering our co-workers excellent benefits and compensation packages. We are deliberately creating an inclusive culture that makes our diverse team of co-workers feel valued, supported, and empowered every day. We're a company made up of thousands of people, all with different stories to share and work to do, but we stand united in our company purpose: world class performance delivering hometown service.

About City of Hope

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 6000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.

Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nation's leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment.

Under minimal supervision the Sr. Research Operations Analyst (SRO) supports daily operations within the department; independently assists with pre and post award activities including budget preparation, proposals, analysis, and project close out. Job Description:
Grow with us! Through training, teamwork, and exposure to challenging technical work, let Leidos show you how to accelerate your career path.
The Defense Group at Leidos currently has an opening for an Operations Intelligence Analyst to work in a customer facility at MacDill AFB, Tampa, FL. This program requires a seasoned, mature professional with prior experience working in higher echelons of military headquarters, experience in handling sensitive information and independent decision making. Must be capable of working as a member of a highly skilled team to accomplish time sensitive, critical tasks. Must be capable of receiving, analyzing, and interpreting general guidance and direction from program leadership to act independently to changing situations.

Candidate will conduct research, create intelligence reports, create assessments, and conduct intelligence briefings on request. Collect, analyze, interpret, evaluate, and integrate complex data from multiple sources to assess relevance and significance of developments in his/her assigned subject matter and geographic area. Attend and participate in conferences and other events as directed. Support management of information, presentation of information, and production of graphics, as well as monitoring multiple intelligence systems. Support future capabilities and technologies efforts. Identify intelligence gaps and recommend requirements to fill. Maintain contact with counterparts in other organizations.


Required Education, Experience, & Skills
Requires 10+ years of relevant, demonstrated experience. Must possess strong GEOINT and Multi-INT experience with a background in China analysis. Excellent research, writing, and briefing skills to customer senior leadership, as they pertain to an intelligence environment supporting critical operations. Experience in augmenting cross-functional, Multi-INT discipline analysis teams, providing situational awareness, intelligence production and analysis for high interest and threats. Experienced in conducting research, creating intelligence products, intelligence estimates assessments, and providing intelligence briefings as requested. expertise in collection, analysis, interpretation, evaluation and integrating complex data from multiple sources to assess relevancy and significance of development for assigned subject matter and geographic areas. experience in collection, analysis, interpretation evaluation, and research utilizing Open Source tools, techniques, methodology, and software.


Customer is requesting a seasoned Intelligence Analyst preferably with multi-INT expertise.
BS degree in GIS, Geography, Intelligence studies, International relations, or related degrees desirable. Expertise in ISIL.

Job Title: Senior Knowledge Analyst- Digital Operations in Consumer Products
Job Description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO
As a Senior Knowledge Analyst (SKA) within BCG's Consumer Practice Area Knowledge Team, you will work in a growing global team, providing industry and functional expertise and insights in Consumer Products Digital Operations whilst working together with case and proposal teams to provide knowledge assets, analysis and expert advisory. In addition, you will support business development and go-to-market efforts, by working with proposal teams, to ensure that they have access to our latest content, and approaches. You’ll serve as a thought partner and content expert to case teams and topic/sector leaders, helping structure and solve complex issues.

Additionally, you will support the Consumer Products Operations topic leadership in developing existing & new intellectual property and knowledge assets. You will work on commercialization efforts In CPG Operations, in conjunction with business leaders. You will support marketing efforts, including conference event presentations and publications. As a Senior Knowledge Analyst you will support and guide consulting staff in selecting the right research approaches, tools and analyses; assist case teams in navigating the Knowledge network and in connecting with relevant materials and people. We are seeking a candidate experienced with the evolving digital tools and capabilities and how they can drive supply chain and manufacturing performance at our clients.

The candidate is expected to have knowledge in at least two or more of the following topics: Digital Supply Chain, Sustainability in Operations, Ecommerce supply chain, Procurement, Supply Chain Sustainability, and Manufacturing & SC Strategy.

BCG’s Consumer Practice is one of the firm's largest industry practice areas and keeps growing
continuously across all regions. BCG’s Consumer practice creates breakthrough innovations for clients in the four sectors: consumer goods, retail, fashion & luxury and travel & tourism.
The ideal candidate will have passion for the Consumer Products sector and enjoy working across multiple cases and stakeholders. Key personal attributes that are required to be successful in the role are:
As a Senior Knowledge Analyst you will collaborate with global topic leads and colleagues across BCG to bring expertise and capabilities to the service of our internal and external clients. Our team is made up of a diverse pool of knowledge positions that allow us to pursue exciting, innovative knowledge careers.
The Knowledge Team (KT) is a group of functional and/or industry experts leveraging deep domain knowledge to enable insight for case teams and clients. KT members are affiliated to BCG Practice Areas, plugged into the strategic agenda and building and deploying leading edge IP data tools/assets to deliver insight.

BCG's Knowledge Team members support cases through deep project engagement or even staffing and help co-create insights with case teams and clients through expert perspectives on industry trends, delivery of proprietary data or tools in a particular function and complex research and analysis of market information. KT members also support the PA’s business development and proposals and help to organize and codify the knowledge that enables BCG to deliver superior business value for its clients.

City of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 6000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.

Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nation's leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment.

Position Summary

Under minimal supervision the Sr. Research Operations Analyst (SRO) supports daily operations within the department; independently assists with pre and post award activities including budget preparation, proposals, analysis, and project close out. Expert knowledge of sponsor institutions (i.e. S2S proposal software, GAAP, ERP/PeopleSoft) with the ability to make decisions independently and experience to be a resource to research operations analysts.

SAP Material Master Analyst (2103535) Research Triangle Park, NC preferred Where the Chemistry Happens We are seeking a professional like you to serve as SAP Material Master Data Analyst.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success Leveraging your experience (in areas such as Operations and Supply Chain) and deep knowledge in Material Master Data (especially, understanding of article creation process, material tree structure – BI, PBG, PRD, Article, KOMBI, zBOM) and its impact to downstream processes, you will manage material master data creation and maintenance for both Seeds articles and Chemical articles for the North America Agriculture business. Your strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills will be essential as you foster a service-oriented relationship with internal stakeholders to meet production / product launch expectations by timely creating accurate material master data and resolving master data issues. Your effective written and verbal communication skills will serve you well as you collaborate with respective regional & Global teams to successfully process material master data requests. Using your advanced experience in MS Word, Excel, Sharepoint, MS Teams, you will document regional master data maintenance processes, SOP's, and support maintenance of team folders. Be creative and curious to support quarterly UAT / regression testings and to make sure system changes are fitting well to AP North American business processes. Experience in using SAP is a must. Experience in project management relating to system transition, integration, merger / acquisition, divesture would be a plus. Experience in using automation tools such as VBA scripts would be a plus. The analyst will be responsible to drive sustainable, operational excellence in the delivery and support of Data and Analytics applications, enhancements, and services across various EIM areas including Data Quality, Metadata Management, Master Data Management, Data Governance and Document and Content Management.

Overview
The System Evaluation Division (SED) has an immediate opening for a research analyst at Schriever SFB, CO to support the Missile Defense Agency (MDA) in analysis of the Command Control Battle Management and Communications (C2BMC) and the Ballistic Missile Defense System (BMDS) Overhead Persistent Infrared (OPIR) Architecture (BOA) elements of the Missile Defense System (MDS) in system level testing. The Institute for Defense Analyses (IDA) is a non-profit corporation that operates three federally funded research and development centers to provide objective analyses of national security issues, particularly those requiring scientific and technical expertise. IDA research staff members conduct multi-disciplinary analyses in an environment encouraging rigorous, independent research on challenging and complex issues. Job Description:
Grow with us! Through training, teamwork, and exposure to challenging technical work, let Leidos show you how to accelerate your career path.
The Defense Group at Leidos currently has an opening for an Operations Intelligence Analyst to work in a customer facility at MacDill AFB, Tampa, FL. This program requires a seasoned, mature professional with prior experience working in higher echelons of military headquarters, experience in handling sensitive information and independent decision making. Must be capable of working as a member of a highly skilled team to accomplish time sensitive, critical tasks. Must be capable of receiving, analyzing, and interpreting general guidance and direction from program leadership to act independently to changing situations.

Candidate will conduct research, create intelligence reports, create assessments, and conduct intelligence briefings on request. Collect, analyze, interpret, evaluate, and integrate complex data from multiple sources to assess relevance and significance of developments in his/her assigned subject matter and geographic area. Attend and participate in conferences and other events as directed. Support management of information, presentation of information, and production of graphics, as well as monitoring multiple intelligence systems. Support future capabilities and technologies efforts. Identify intelligence gaps and recommend requirements to fill. Maintain contact with counterparts in other organizations.


Required Education, Experience, & Skills
Requires 10+ years of relevant, demonstrated experience. Must possess strong GEOINT and Multi-INT experience with a background in China analysis. Excellent research, writing, and briefing skills to customer senior leadership, as they pertain to an intelligence environment supporting critical operations. Experience in augmenting cross-functional, Multi-INT discipline analysis teams, providing situational awareness, intelligence production and analysis for high interest and threats. Experienced in conducting research, creating intelligence products, intelligence estimates assessments, and providing intelligence briefings as requested. expertise in collection, analysis, interpretation, evaluation and integrating complex data from multiple sources to assess relevancy and significance of development for assigned subject matter and geographic areas. experience in collection, analysis, interpretation evaluation, and research utilizing Open Source tools, techniques, methodology, and software.


Customer is requesting a seasoned Intelligence Analyst preferably with multi-INT expertise.
BS degree in GIS, Geography, Intelligence studies, International relations, or related degrees desirable. Expertise in ISIL.


BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

Intelligence & Security (I&S), based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.

At BAE Systems, we celebrate the array of skills, experiences, and perspectives our employees bring to the table. For us, differences are a source of strength. We’re laser-focused on high performance, and we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where all employees can innovate and thrive. Here, you will not only build your career, but you will also enjoy work-life balance, uncover new experiences, and collaborate with passionate colleagues.
